Juan solicita un segundo crédito para incrementar la producción de su trabajo, requiere comprar 10 quintales de fertilízante urea y gasolina, de manera que pueda acondicionar la tierra y el cultivo sea un éxito; al mismo tiempo poder desplazarse sin ningún problema. Él está muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento de KIVA  a través de MiCrédito con el que logró alquilar tierras para la siembra y obtener buenas ganancias por el producto sembrado. Uno de sus objetivos es seguir cultivando para cumplir la demanda de su clientela y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Enormous mountains accompanied by a refreshing breeze and a brilliant sun are what the good days offer to Juan Carlos when he goes to his rice plantings to check that everything is going well.  He is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 2 children. He began his farming business nine years ago, which has become his primary source of income. His life partner has been his right hand; together they fight to offer their children better living conditions.

Juan asks for a second loan to increase the production of his farming; he needs to buy 10 quintals (1000 pounds) of urea fertilizer and gasoline so that he can prepare the soil and the crop will be a success. At the same time, he will be able to get around with out any problems. He is very grateful for the first Kiva loan through MiCrédito with which he managed to rent land to plant and get good earnings for the product he planted. One of his goals is to continue cultivation to meet his customers' demand and, in turn, increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase 10 quintals (1000 pounds) of urea fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more different types of stationery items, such as books and pens, to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
"Allen is a hard working woman. Allen is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Allen has been working hard to manage her shoe-vending business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fashionable shoes, and it will help Allen to generate greater profits and personal development. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy more fashionable shoes

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
"Aisha is a hard working woman. Aisha is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her hotel business, which renders services as a mini hotel. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items for the hotel, and it will help Aisha to generate greater profits and educate her child. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy food items for the hotel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weaves and chemicals

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
"Aisha is a hard working woman. Aisha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past 2 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials, threads and other requirements, and it will help Aisha to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy materials, threads and other requirements

loans.name: Jemewo

texts.en:
"Jamewo is a hard working woman. Jamewo is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 4 years, Jamewo has been working hard to manage her agriculture business, which rears pigs. 

To help expand her business, Jamewo has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more piglets, and it will help Jamewo to generate greater profits and upgrade her education. Jamewo hopes that in the future she will be able to become an electrician. 

Jamewo is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of corn to expand her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hard working woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 4 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her agriculture business, rearing  goats. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goats and feeds, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and personal development. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to enroll in school. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more goats and feeds

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Doña francisca de 51 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, ella comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, doña francisca necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, doña francisca tiene buenas referencias de pago y está segura que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Francisca, 51 years old, lives with her husband and their two children. She works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and vegetables. She has worked in this field for many years and has made a very valiant effort that permits her to get better harvests. The land that she cultivates is located in an agricultural zone. She sells in all the neighboring zones and has a large regular customer base. These people always prefer her product for its quality and the very accessible prices, in addition to her unequaled service. Francisca needs to invest in supplies but she needs the capital, so she asks INTEGRAL for a loan that will permit her to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticide, tools, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photo. Francisca has good credit references and is sure that she will be able to pay off her debt on time, and at the same time she is confident that she will be able to give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticide, tools, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Santos Arely

texts.es:
Santos tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, solo tiene una hija y depende de ella.


Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, actividad que tiene 2 años de realizar y la aprendió de su padre, y además su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas para fertilizar el cultivo del maíz, además comprará 2 quintales de concentrado para alimentar los cerdos.


Ella sueña con seguir trabajando en la crianza de cerdos, actividad que le genera ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, las ganancias las invertirá en comprar mas cerdos pequeños para engordarlos y luego venderlos.
texts.en:
Santos is 26 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade, currently is partnered and her partner works transporting passengers. She only has one daughter and she depends on Santos. 

She works raising pigs, a line of work that she began two years ago and learned from her father. In addition, her partner helps her with the household expenses. 

She needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies to fertilize her corn crop, in addition she will purchase 2 quintals (200 pounds) of concentrated pig feed.

She dreams of continuing working raising pigs, a job that generates income to improve her living conditions. She will invest the earnings in the purchase of more piglets to fatten them and later sell them.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to fertilize her corn crop, in addition she will purchase 2 quintals (200 pounds) of concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a hard working woman. Rita is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rita has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rita has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Rita to generate greater profits and educate her child. Rita hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a boutique. 

Rita is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a hard working woman. Winnie is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her phone accessories business, where she sells phones. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones, and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more phones.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
"Cathy is a hard working woman. Cathy is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 1 year, Cathy has been working hard to manage her canteen business, which sells drinks. 

To help expand her business, Cathy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as sodas, water, and juice, and it will help Cathy to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Cathy hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a factory that processes drinks. 

Cathy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as sodas, water, and juice

loans.name: Retinah

texts.en:
"Retinah is a hard working woman. Retinah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Retinah has been working hard to manage her canteen business, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Retinah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sodas, juice, and water, and it will help Retinah to generate greater profits and save money for education. Retinah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Retinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy sodas, juice, and water

loans.name: Maria Del Trancito

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Maria es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo quien estudia en la universidad y trabaja para ayudarle en los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, verduras, granos básicos, sopas, café, etc. y asi poder tener junto con su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 52 years old, has had a small store located in her home for a number of years. She has many customers due to her good prices and the friendliness she shows while making the sale. Maria is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her child who is a university student and works to help her with the household costs. She is asking for a loan to purchase candies, soft drinks, vegetables, basic grains, soup, coffee, etc. and, in turn, to be able to have a better quality of life with her son.

loans.use: to purchase candies, soft drinks, vegetables, basic grains, soup, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra los principales granos básico como: maíz y frijol y también tiene cosecha de yuca, él comercializa sus productos con los comerciantes de su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas ha salido adelante con su familia, ahora él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar todo lo necesario para sus cosechas como: abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, entre otras cosas y así darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cosechas de maíz, frijol y yuca, y seguir obteniendo mejores ganancias para darle a su familia un mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jose, 34 years old, lives with his wife and his daughter in his own house. He works in agriculture and grows the common staple products such as corn and beans, and also has a crop of yucca.  He sells his products to the business people where he lives and, with the earnings that he gets from the sales, he has gotten ahead with his family. Now he is asking for a loan that will permit him to buy everything that is necessary for his crops such as manure, fertilizer, and seeds, among other things, and to be able to maintain his corn, bean and yucca crops better, and continue getting improved earnings to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and seeds, among other things

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hardworking woman who greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially.

Margaret operates various business in addition to the motorcycle business. She owns a retail shop and sells wraps that women use as clothes (lessos). She is requesting a loan to purchase more lessos for her business.

She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more lessos (wraps that women use as clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
A common perception is that water is an infinite resource. However, water scarcity is already a critical constraint to farming in many parts of the world, including Kenya. Geoffrey is a small-holder farmer in Kisii which is a primary banana and sugarcane production area in Kenya. He has a wife and a child who depend on him for a living. For the last 6 years, he has been involved in mixed farming. He grows crops and keeps livestock on his farm. His success in agriculture is highly dependent upon him having sufficient access to water. 

Geoffrey is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. He is planning to harvest rain water during the rainy seasons and preserve it for the dry seasons. The majority of this water will be used for irrigation. An increase in irrigation usage guarantees an increase in crop production on his farm, which does not receive enough precipitation annually.

Your contribution towards this loan will ensure vegetative growth and development of plants by provision of water in adequate quantity and at the right time. Livestock also have specific water requirements, and these vary depending on local conditions. A water tank for Geoffrey is useful for storage when water is in excess, and it also ensures continuous flow when there is a shortage.

He is planning to spend the income generated from this asset to reinvest in better water conservation practices, such as drip irrigation for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a hard working woman. Zaina is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Zaina has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Zaina has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Zaina to generate greater profits and educate her children. Zaina hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Zaina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
"Victo is a hard working woman. Victo is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has 2 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Victo has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Victo has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and it will help Victo to generate greater profits and develop the family's well-being. Victo hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Victo is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Moureen's Group

texts.en:
"Moureen's group is comprised of hard working women. Moureen is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has 2 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 1 year, Moureen has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells food items such as cassava, sweet potatoes, and eggplants. 

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items to add to the business, and it will help Moureen to generate greater profits and personal development. Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Moureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy more food items to add to the business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
"Sarah is a hard working woman. Sarah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells food items. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy Irish (white potato) and other food items, and it will help Sarah to generate greater profits and provide for her family. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big restaurant. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training."

loans.use: to buy Irish (white potato) and other food items

loans.name: Nashifah

texts.en:
Nashifah is a hard working woman. Nashifah is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Nashifah has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, where she sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Nashifah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials and threads, and will help Nashifah to generate greater profits and undertake personal development. Nashifah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Nashifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials and threads.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hard working woman. Daisy is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past 2 years, Daisy has been working hard to manage her library, which deals with library work. 

To help expand her business, Daisy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy books for the library, and will help Daisy to generate greater profits and educate her child. Daisy hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Daisy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy books for the library.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
Juana es una señora muy emprendedora de 66 años de edad, a pesar de que pasó tiempo de su vida brindando servicio como secretaria siendo madre soltera, hizo todo por darle lo mejor a su única hija quien lastimosamente falleció por una grave enfermedad y dejó una niña de 9 años de edad, por lo cual Juana  se hizo cargo de la niña.
Juana vive con su nieta quien ya tiene 20 años y también trabaja, además atienda la tienda que tiene desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, ella  vende golosinas, productos de consumo básico y bebidas frías.


Con el crédito comprará más mercadería para su tienda ya que por el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para invertir.

Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio para apoyar a su nieta con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is a very enterprising 66-year-old woman. Despite having spent her life working as a secretary, as a single mother, she did all that she could in order to give the best to her only daughter who, sadly died due to a serious illness and left a 9-year-old girl, and Juana took on the care for the girl.

Juana lives with her granddaughter, who now is 20 years old and also works. In addition, she runs the store that she has from 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 at night. She sells candies, basic foods, and cold drinks.

With the loan, she will purchase more merchandise for her store since at the moment she doesn't have the sufficient capital to invest.

Her dream is to expand her business to help her granddaughter with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa de 52 años de edad posee en su lugar de residencia una pequeña tienda donde comercializa diferentes productos como: huevos, granos básicos, papel higiénico, detergentes, sopas, refrescos, golosinas, etc. con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Rosa vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está  solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y así seguir con sus ventas y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa, 52 years old, has in her residence a small store where she sells different products such as eggs, basic grains, toilet paper, detergent, soup, soft drinks, candies, etc. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to cover the household expenses. Rosa lives in her own house with her family. She is asking for a loan to purchase more products in bulk and, in turn, to continue with her sales and be able to have a better quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, basic grains, toilet paper, detergent, soup, soft drinks, candies, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas desde hace varios años, comercializa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Elena está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elena has worked selling candies and snacks for a number of years. She sells them as a street vendor in different colonies that are near where she lives. She lives in her own house with her family. Elena is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise in bulk in order to be able to continue with her sales and, in turn, be able to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase candies and snacks in bulk.

loans.name: Paskalia

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Paskalia. She is strong, hardworking mother of 2 boys and 2 girls. The 51-year-old lady is a well-known progressive farmer from Nyaura village. She has been doing mixed farming for many years and developed passion for dairy farming. To generate income, she sells produce from her farm including milk at the local market.  

Like any serious dairy farmer, Paskalia takes animal health very seriously. She believes healthy animals are more productive and cheaper to maintain. The major challenge farmers in her area are facing is lack of good road network. This makes transportation of produce to the market an uphill task and costly.  

Paskalia is seeking a loan to purchase a quality dairy cow. The cow breed she is going for produces more than 15 litres of milk a day: Milk sold from this cow will provide Paskalia with a sufficient income to repay the loan. Income from milk sales is preferable to many farmers since it comes regularly.  

Paskalia has a clear business plan. Juhudi Kilimo has been very encouraging and supportive to such progressive farmers. We want her farm to be an example to other farmers who have potential but are constrained by funds.

Paskalia’s extra income that she will generate from the cow will go to satisfying her family needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pedro Eugenio

texts.es: Pedro de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de sabanas y hamacas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro, 38 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has worked selling sheets and hammocks for a number of years. His business is located in a market that is near where he lives. He has many customers for the quality of his products and the good prices. Pedro is asking for a loan to purchase more merchandise in bulk in order to continue with his work and, in turn, to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and hammocks in bulk.

loans.name: Andres Alexander

texts.es: Andrés vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up a las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Andrés quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar cemento, arena, cerámica y pago de mano de obra y así poder poner el piso cerámico y afinar las paredes para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Andrés lives in his own house with his wife and children. He works making trips in his pickup to the different colonies; with what he earns from his work he manages to pay the household expenses. Andrés want to improve his house but with what he earns at his job he doesn't have enough to be able to do it. For this reason, he asks INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to purchase cement, sand, tiles, and pay labor costs, and in this way be able to put a tile floor and finish the walls so his family can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, tiles, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Fausto de 41 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, él creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad,  su familia esta formada por dos hijos y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias que realiza para llevar el sustento a la familia.


Fausto  se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a sus hijos, y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y en la tarde trabaja en otras parcelas limpiado o sembrando.

 
El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. cuenta  con la experiencia necesaria de varios años para llegar a obtener una buena cosecha  que le generará ingresos para la manuteción de su familia 

Él  planea en un futuro comprar ganado y generar producción de leche con ayuda de otro crédito.
texts.en:
Fausto is 41 years old and works in agriculture. He grew up with his parents who taught him about farming. His family consists of his wife and two children who help him in the daily activities he does to provide for the family.

Fausto gets up at 5am to go to the plots of land where he works with his children in the mornings. His wife looks after the house and in the afternoons works on other plots of land, weeding or sowing seed.

Fausto needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as poison, seeds, manure etc. He has gained the necessary experience over several years to be able to produce a good harvest which will generate an income for him to support his family.

In the future he hopes to buy cattle and start producing milk, with the help of another loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as poison, seeds, manure etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old. She is a single mother of one child who is four years old. She has a farming activity and earns an income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She is now servicing her first loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this loan amount to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to grow her business and venture into large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro de 64 años se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, el creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estas actividades y que desempeña hace mas de 50 años,  su familia esta formada por cuatro hijos quienes viven aparte, solo uno convive con él y su esposa quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias

Pedro se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ordeñar y luego irse a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a su hijo, y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar las vacas que poseen.

 
El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas como veneno, semilla, abono, etc. Que necesita para la siembra.

Pedro planea en un futuro tener mas ganado de ordeño en un corral propio.
texts.en:
Pedro, 64 years old, works in agriculture and animal husbandry. He grew up with his parents who taught him this work and which he has done for more than 50 years. His family is made up of four sons who live on their own, only one lives with him and his wife, who help with the daily chores.

Pedro gets up at 4:30 am to milk, then he goes to his farm plots where he works during the morning with his son, and his wife takes care of the household chores and cares for the cows they have.

The loan is needed to purchase agricultural supplies such as pesticide, seeds, fertilizer, etc., which he needs for his crops. 

Pedro plans in the future to have more dairy cows in his own corral.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as pesticide, seeds, fertilizer, etc., which he needs for the crops.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is a hard working woman. Jackie is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Jackie has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, beans, posho and flour. 

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, beans, posho and flour and will help Jackie to generate greater profits and expand the business. Jackie hopes that in the future she will be able to become a trader. 

Jackie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, posho and flour.

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is a hard working woman. Proscovia is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Proscovia has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Proscovia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Proscovia to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Proscovia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Proscovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Maria Rafaela

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su adre y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de recuerdos para toda ocasión como: bodas, bautizos, 15 años, etc. desde hace 9 años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene clientela fija por los buenos precios y la calidad del producto, Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  de materia prima como: papel fomy de colores, silicón, moldes, etc. todo por mayor para seguir elaborando mas productos y si tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 37, lives in the house of a family member with her parent and her child. She has worked selling and making mementos for all types of occasions such as weddings, baptisms, 15th birthdays, etc. for the past 9 years. She has the business in her home and sells them as a street vendor in different markets. She has regular customers because of her good prices and the quality of her products. Maria is asking for a loan to be able to purchase raw material such as colored foam paper, silicon, molds, etc. in bulk in order to continue making her products and, in turn, have a better quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: to purchase colored foam paper, silicon, molds, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Hilda Janeth

texts.es:
Hilda es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 6 meses se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación.
Hilda está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder surtir su negocio y ofrecer productos variados a los clientes. Con esto obtendrá mayores ingresos y más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su negocio propio".
texts.en:
Hilda is an enterprising young woman. She is 19 years old, single, and lives in Parcona with her family.

For the past 6 months she has worked selling beauty products from a catalog. It is going very well for her because she is a hard-working and responsible person with a strong desire to improve herself.

Hilda is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase merchandise to be able to stock her business and offer a variety of products to her customers. With this, she will get more income and in the future will realize her big dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to open a business.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet a 31-year-old smallholder farmer going by the name of Everline. She is a wife to a lovely husband and a mother to 5 sons! Everline comes from a village near a rural town in Kenya called Kisii. Nyaura village is a rain-fed area with most constituents practising agriculture. Despite the area having no drought, crop failure is a common occurrence. Poverty offers permanent company to the farmers. Rocky soils, underfed cattle, poor farming techniques and poor road network are the natural scenes of the area.

Everline is a mixed farmer with a bias towards dairy farming. She loves cows! She takes good care of them. Milk provides her family with food and regular income. As her sons grow, her family’s needs keep increasing. She constantly strives to make more income to meet her duties and responsibilities as a parent.

Everline is seeking a loan from Kiva Lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a hybrid dairy cow. The additional cow will produce 15 to 20 litres of additional milk per day. This will significantly increase the volume Everline takes to the market. 

Investing in Everline will provide her with the necessary support she needs to elevate her livelihood and meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sandy Priscila

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Sandy, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tienen un  hijo de 3 años, su marido trabaja en una empresa local.
Doña Sandy para ganar algo por su cuenta para beneficio de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, por temporada tiene hasta 200 pollos en un galpón en su casa ya que cuenta con el espacio suficiente, ella los alimenta por tres  meses luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos, para llevarlos a los mercados de la ciudad y la provincia, lleva más de tres años dedicada a esta actividad.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The 'El Pedregal' communal bank meets once a fortnight in the location of Pedregal in the parish of Picoaza, city of Portoviejo.  This place is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional festivals of Saints Peter and Paul and for the happy disposition of its people.

This is where Sandy lives. She is 22 years old and lives with a partner. From their relationship they have a 3-year-old son. Her partner works for a local company.

In order to earn something herself towards supporting the household, Sandy raises chickens. Each season she has up to 200 chickens in a poultry shed at her home, since she has enough space. She feeds them for three months and then sells them to traders who come to her house to buy them, to take them to markets in the city and the province. She has been doing this for more than three years.

The loan is to buy feed and medication for the chickens. She has been in the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because the loans really help her to make progress in life. 

Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy feed and medication for chickens.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of one child who goes to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She make soft drinks using fruits and juice flavor and sells it to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors and fruits for the business.

loans.name: Langoni

texts.en:
Langoni is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, onions for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, onions for her business.

loans.name: Mwanakonze

texts.en:
This is Mwanakonze. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more food ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, onions for her business.

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, onions for her business.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old, and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Moureen has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Moureen has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items for the business, and will help Moureen to generate greater profits and family development. 

Moureen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business to another outlet. 

Moureen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items for the business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 26-year-old married lady who supports a family of four children.  Her husband adds an additional income to cater for their family welfare.  Susan has been operating a retail business shop for a period of four years, earning an income of KES. 5,000 at the end of every month.

Susan is now servicing her third loan of KES. 45,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount to stock her retail shop with a greater variety of goods.  

She plans to use the anticipated income build a permanent house and educate her children.

loans.use: To add more stock of basic commodities

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema's group is comprised of two hard working women. Rehema is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her brick business, which deals in bricks. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for bricks, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits and boost personal development. Rehema hopes that in the future she will be able to become a business entreprenuer. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials for bricks.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Wilkister. She is a mother of 2 girls and 2 boys who is practising mixed farming in rainfed Kisii region in Kenya. She sells her farm produce at a local market once a week during the market-day. She has put many years into farming. She also engages in other seasonal businesses around farming to make extra money.

Wilkister is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She favours poultry farming because of the regular income generation. The additional poultry will boost her egg output. Egg prices are consistent and the market is ready. However, the biggest challenges she faces are poor roads and lack of market for other farm produce since everyone is involved in farming.

Wilkister will use the additional income to take care of her children’s education. Her future dream is to provide her children will everything necessary to help them lead a much improved lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Gndevaz village in the Vayots Dzor region with her husband, mother and 15-year-old daughter. She works as a teacher in the local kindergarten. 

To be able to meet her family’s needs, Armine, with the help of her husband, is also extensively engaged in agribusiness. They keep cows, sheep, goats, hens and bees. They also own an orchard and grow various fruits there. The family really tries hard to make ends meet. 

Armine's mother is a 74-year-old pensioner. Moreover, her daughter is a teenager, so only Armine and her husband are fully engaged in agricultural activities. 

Armine had taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her agribusiness, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. 

Armine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. 

The loan will enable her to purchase two calves and one cow. 

Armine and her family really hope to receive support from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (1 cow and 2 calves)

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure for her cornfield.

loans.name: Nusufa

texts.en:
Nusufa is a hardworking woman. She is 18 years old, and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past three years, Nusufa has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Nusufa has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and will help Nusufa to generate greater profits and self development. 

Nusufa hopes that in the future she will be able to return to school. 

Nusufa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a hard-working woman. Annet is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past 2 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items for the restaurant, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and have personal development. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items for the restaurant.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old, and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her saloon and clothing business, selling clothes & hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and items for the saloon, and will help her to generate greater profits and develop the family well being. 

Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a car. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes and items for the saloon

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a hard-working woman. Dorah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Dorah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Dorah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sodas, water, beers, cooked food, and will help Dorah to generate greater profits and provide for her siblings. Dorah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Dorah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, beers, cooked food.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a hard-working woman. Alice is 22 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past 4 years, Alice has been working hard to manage her poultry business, where she rears chickens. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry birds, and will help Alice to generate greater profits and carry out personal development. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hard-working woman. Christine is 19 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her poultry business, where she rears chickens. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry birds, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and carry out personal development. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hard-working woman. Rebecca is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her food stall business, where she sells bananas, potatoes, cassava. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bananas, cassava, potatoes, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and ensure family development. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to return to school. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, cassava, potatoes.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Alpha from Wara Wara in Freetown. He is married with 3 children between the ages of two and 13 years.  He started this business to be self-reliant. 

Alpha runs a general stock business; he sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2002. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Alpha says that the main challenge to his is business is price inflation.

Alpha has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Bayuku

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Bayuku from Wara Wara, Freetown. He is married with 2 children. 

Bayuku runs a general stock business; he sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2011. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Bayuku says that the main challenge to his business is that sometimes purchasing power is very low.

Bayuku has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become successful business man and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking woman. Jennifer is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has no children. 

For the past five years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, beans and posho (cornmeal porridge). 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like posho, rice, curry powder and salt, and it will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and expand her business. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a salon. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more items like posho, rice, curry powder and salt.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hard-working woman. Judith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has two children, neither of them are currently at school. For the past 3 years, Judith has been working hard to manage her salon business, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chemicals and weaves, and will help Judith to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her children. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more chemicals and weaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Hilda Mercedes

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Hilda, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 3 años, la mayor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Hilda es  un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de de pañales, paños húmedos, papel higiénico, entre otras cosas, ella sale a recorrer por toda la localidad y sitios aledaños vendiendo sus productos y también  vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local, su marido le ayuda con los recorridos cuando él puede, lleva más de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar papel higiénico, paños húmedos, pañales entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The credit group "El Pedregal" meets every 15 days in the El Pedregal section of Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its significant commercial activity, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the cheerfulness of its people.

In this area lives Hilda, who is 33 years old, married, and has two children, ages 17 and 3. Her oldest daughter is in high school. Her husband works as a driver.

Hilda is a housewife who, to earn her own money, works selling diapers, wipes and toilet tissue, among other items. She travels throughout her community and neighboring communities selling her products. She also sells from her home, where she has a small area set up for sales. Her husband helps her with her route when he can. She has had this business for more than three years now, and it is helping her to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy toilet tissue, wipes and diapers, among other items.

She has been a member of the credit group since its inception, and she likes it because of the help she receives with loans.

She dreams of one day having a large store.

loans.use: to buy toilet tissue, wipes and diapers for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 42 years old and married to Joyce, who is a business lady and also contributes to the income for the family. They are blessed with seven school-going children.

He has been practising crop farming and has also run a retail shop for the last 12 years. He makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 with which he intends to buy farm inputs and also add more stock of sugar and cooking oil for the retail shop.

Stephen desires to grow his business and give his children good education.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and also add more stock of sugar and cooking oil for the retail shop.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Louise. This beautiful young farmer lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which produces coffee for export. She has a daughter with a great husband with whom she has been doing farming for six years. Her primary income sources are eggs, tea and a variety of crops.

She is very appreciative of the fact that farming is a fulfilling and sustaining economic activity. Her biggest challenge, however, is raising capital for expansion. She has had dreams of expanding her poultry farming, which happens to be her favourite farming activity. 

Louise is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry and construct a piggery. The purchase of poultry will double the volume of eggs she sells at the market. This investment will double the income she makes from poultry. She is also preparing to invest in pig farming, which is currently performing better than beef farming. 

Louise was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Uplift myself."  This client has also been through a microfinance training session where she learnt about loan management. She understands the expectations that lenders have for the money with which they are entrusting her. 

Your loan will enable Louise to generate enough income to comfortably deal with other farming costs that compose her highest monthly expenses. She will also use the income to meet her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and construct a piggery.

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años de edad, es una persona que solo cuenta con segundo grado de formación académica, se casó y formó una familia de tres hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos, de sus tres hijos solo dos viven con ellos quienes ayudan en el trabajo agrícola y no estudian. 

Ella con su esposo siempre se han dedicado a la agricultura contando con más de 20 años de experiencia, se dedican a esta actividad porque producen granos para el consumo y además para la venta, no tienen ninguna otra actividad económica; el lugar de trabajo les queda a 5 km de su casa y viajan caminando, todos como familia colaboran en la realización de las diferentes labores del cultivo.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y pesticidas para darle un buen manejo al cultivo y que resulte una buena cosecha para tener para el consumo en su casa y vender. 

Ella espera que el cultivo le rinda al máximo y tener buenas ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia, además desea mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She went to school only until the second grade. Her husband works in agriculture, growing basic grains. Two of her children still live with her and husband. They help with the agricultural work and do not go to school.

María and her husband have always worked in agriculture, having now more than 20 years of experience. The grow grain both for their family to eat and to sell. They do not have any other economic activities. Their field is five kilometers from their house, and they travel to and from it on foot. All of the family helps with the different parts of the agricultural work.

María is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to care for her crops. She hopes to obtain a good harvest both to feed her family and to sell. She hopes that her crops yield a maximum harvest and that she earns a good profit, because she would like to improve her family's quality of life and make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her grain crops.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking woman. Juliet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has three children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her food stall business, in which she sells bananas, potatoes and cassava. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cassava, potatoes and bananas, and it will help Juliet to generate greater profits and provide her basic needs. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to open a chicken farm. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Herlinda Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Pedregal  se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Herlinda, tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esa relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 4  años, su marido es comerciante.
Doña Herlinda es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos tanto  para ella como para el negocio de su esposo, el se dedica a la venta de accesorios y repuestos de teléfonos, entre otras cosas, su forma de venta es ambulante, el se desplaza hasta otras ciudades o por el centro de la ciudad para  ofrecer sus productos, ella por su parte también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella recorre la localidad ofreciendo sus prendas las mismas que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días.  Ella lleva 10 dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo extra por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar accesorios para telefónicos y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group "El Pedregal" meets every 15 days in the El Pedregal section of Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for its significant commercial activity, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the cheerfulness of its people.

In this area lives Herlinda, who is 29 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has two children, ages 8 and 4. Her husband works in sales.

Herlinda is a housewife who is requesting a loan both for herself and for her husband's business. He works selling accessories and spare parts for telephones, among other items. He sells from place to place, traveling to the center of their city or to other cities to sell his products. Herlinda works selling a wide variety of clothing. She also travels around their city selling clothing, which she sells on credit and then collects payment every eight days. Herlinda has had this business for 10 years, and with it she has been able to earn some extra money for her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy telephone accessories and a variety of clothing.

She has been a member of the credit group since its inception, and she likes it because the loans are helping her to get ahead.

Her dream is to be able to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for her business and telephone accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is a hardworking woman. Mastula is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past two years, Mastula has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, in which she sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy materials, threads and a machine, and it will help Mastula to generate greater profits and personal development. Mastula hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Mastula is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy materials, threads and a machine.

loans.name: José Lucio

texts.es:
José tiene 55 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado ya que en su tiempo eran pocos los que contaban con el privilegio de estudiar, se casó; su esposa es ama de casa realiza las tareas del hogar y la atención y cuidado de sus hijos, tiene dos hijos los cuales no estudian sino que trabajan también en la agricultura junto con él. 

Desde hace más de 25 años trabaja la agricultura siendo esta la actividad económica a la que él se dedica y lo aprendió de su padre, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que produce granos básicos para el consumo de su familia y para vender los excedentes, sus hijos y su esposa colaboran también en las tareas que hay que realizar en la milpa, trabaja casi todos los días 8 horas o más.

Debido a que su cultivo se encuentra en la etapa de aplicación de fertilizante se vio en la necesidad de solicitar este financiamiento, para comprar el abono y aplicarlo a su cultivo y tener una buena cosecha y que el alimento no falte en su casa. 

Él espera sacar una buena ganancia de la producción de la milpa y que no falte el alimento en su casa, desea que sus hijos aprendan un oficio que les genere ingresos o que estos puedan retomar la escuela.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old. He studied as far as second grade, since in his day very few had the privilege of going to school. He got married; his wife is a housewife and does the housework and looks after the children. He has two children who are not at school but work in agriculture alongside him. 

He has worked in agriculture for more than 25 years and it is his means of earning a living. He learnt the skills from his father. He decided on this kind of work since it provides basic grains for his family's consumption and he sells the excess. His wife and children also work with him doing the jobs which need to be done in the cornfield. He works for more than 8 hours almost every day. 

Since his crop is at the stage where he needs to apply fertilizer he felt the need to apply for this loan to buy manure. He will apply this to his crop so he gets a good harvest and so that there will not be a shortage of food in the house.

He hopes to make a good profit from the corn harvest and hopes there will be no shortage of food in the house. He hopes his children will learn a skill which will provide them with an income and hopes they will be able to recommence their schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure to apply to his crop so he can have a good harvest.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is an experienced farmer from Eghegnavan village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband, mother and two little children (one son and one daughter). 

Jointly with her family members, Armine has been running a farm for 15 years already. They cultivate corn, watermelon, and different fruits (apples, apricots). The family is also engaged in animal husbandry and keeps cows and oxen. 

Now, Armine wants to expand her agribusiness to be able to effectively meet the growing needs of her family. A loan of USD 1,600 will enable her to buy an ox, 20 bags of fertilizers and chemicals for plants as well as pay water bills and finance the soil-plowing process. 

As this is Armine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (one ox), fertilizers (20 bags), chemicals for plants, and to pay water bills and finance the soil-plowing process.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a hardworking woman. Resty is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past year, Resty has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and it will help Resty to generate greater profits and educate her child. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lender, meet Jackline. She is a very hardworking and determined smallholder farmer in Kisii who is the sole breadwinner. She is a mother of  three boys and she is engaged in mixed-farming. She owns a small piece of land where she lives together with her family.

Poultry farming is a good extension of who Jackline really is. She is seeking a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry. Poultry business is very lucrative and constantly growing. Jackline tried her hand at poultry and she found it to be very successful. With the additional chickens she will acquire, she is going to increase her poultry output by more than 50%.

With your loan, Jackline will increase her sales volume and turn more profits in future. She plans on maintaining a high customer satisfaction rate by reinforcing relationships with them and producing enough eggs to meet even more than the unexpected demand. 

Additional income from this expansion will be ploughed back to the business for growth. From the investment, her family will enjoy an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a hardworking woman. She is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. Racheal has one child. For the past year, she has been working hard to manage her shop where she sells sugar, soap, salt, rice, and beans. 

Racheal is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and detergent to help expand her business. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and provide for her child and family. Racheal hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on her business. 

Racheal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt, soap, and detergent

loans.name: Mikoroshini Group

texts.en:
Thomas, in his 40s, is a father of two schooling children. He has been with Tujijenge for four loan cycles. He is married and supports his family by managing a general store selling dry foods like sugar, baking and maize flour and other home items. He has been in this business since 2008 and is able to make a good profit each month. 

He used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to replenish his shop with the most demanded products. He is so thankful for Kiva's support. Thomas earned a profit that he used to cover school fees and household expenses. He also built a house for his family. 

Thomas dreams that one day he will be able to manage a wholesale shop. He will use this loan to purchase shop stocks of sugar, rice, sodas, maize and baking flour, etc.
 
He will share this credit with his credit group,"Mikoroshini," which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, sodas, maize, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
