Alice is a hardworking woman. Alice is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She has two children with none of them currently in school. For the past five months, Alice has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, and it will help Alice to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 24 years old and lives in the the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her poultry business. 

Harriet is requesting a 600,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more chicks. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and add capital to the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, solo estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela y el otro por la corta edad todavía no va los tres dependen económicamente de Manuel. 

Su actividad generadora de ingresos es transportar personas en un pick-up que posee, actividad a la que se ha dedicado por más de 5 años y decidió realizarla ya que las personas demandaban de la necesidad de un medio de transporte y es una forma digna de obtener ingresos para el sostén de la familia. 

El crédito solicitado es para  comprar material de construcción ya que está construyendo un cuarto para baño y ducha y para continuar repellando su casa ya que es de adobe y así tener una casa bonita para que sus hijos y su esposa se sientan orgullosos de vivir en un ambiente más cómodo y agradable.

Él sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante y que estudien para optar por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old, and he only went to school as far as the fourth grade. He is married and his spouse is a housewife. They have three children; two are in school and the other, as he is still very young, doesn't attend. The three of them are economically dependent on Manuel.

His money-making activity is transporting people in a pick-up truck that he has, which he has done for over five years. He decided to do this since people needed a means of transport, and it is an honest way to earn a living to support his family.

The loan requested is to buy construction materials, as he is building a room for a bath and shower, and to continue re-tiling his house, as it is made of adobe, and in this way he can have a nice house so that his children and wife will feel proud to live in a more comfortable and agreeable environment.

He dreams that his children will get ahead in life and that they will study in order to choose a better future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, as he is building a room for a bath and shower, and to continue re-tiling his house

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha is a new client. He is a resident of Rwentobo, aged 45 years old. Twaha is dealing in agriculture, especially goat rearing, and wants to buy more of the goats so that he can increase his income after he has sold them. He is lacking enough money to buy them and also hire labor; that’s why he has come to UGAFODE for a loan, hoping that it can change his standard of living. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings. He is optimistic the loan will increase his sales and income in the long run. He appreciates UGAFODE's services and looks forward to maintaining the partnership.

loans.use: To buy goats for selling

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Beatrice has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocery in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Milly has been working hard to run her business where she manages money services and deals in Airtel money. She is the member of a group of hardworking women. 

Milly is requesting a 600,000 UGX loan from from BRAC Uganda to add money into her business and expand her business. She will use her loan to generate greater profits and expand her capital base. Milly hopes that in the future she will be able to accumulate profit to use for her studies. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: add money to her business

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Memunatu. She is married, and has four children, aged 24, 19, 17 and 9 years respectively; all are school-going children. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered. 

Memunatu owns a used shoes and toys business. Working many days a week and hours a day, she earns about 1,080,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Memunatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used shoes and toys. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to expand the business and educate her children. This loan will help her to achieve her plans. She is an ambitious and honest businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of used shoes and toys.

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is a businesswoman who has been managing a general store selling different items, including sugar, rice, noodles, etc. She has been in this enterprise for five years and is able to make a good return. Before, Mgeni was running a grocery business, but switched to a general store after long loss periods. She is married and has a grown son and daughter. She is living with her grandkids who are at school. Mgeni is in her shop from 6 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. per working day.

With Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 15th loan cycle. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to restock her shop with missing items. She started ordering direct from the producing company rather than buying from wholesale shops. By doing so, she will be able to save transport cost, since they will deliver those items freely to her shop. 

She is so proud with Kiva's support, and she believes to grow more. Mgeni received a profit, which she used to buy a home fridge and a grandkid bed and mattress, and she covered part of the household expenses. She will use this loan to buy shop inventory of cooking oil, rice, beans, baking and maize flour, sugar, noodles, etc. She dreams of managing a wholesale shop.

Mgeni will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Ulunguru," which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop inventory of cooking oil, rice, beans, baking and maize flour, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Viviana Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito El Almendro. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 25 años de edad está casada pero aun no tiene  hijos. Su marido se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción.
Doña Viviana es una mujer muy luchadora que  para salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y artículos para el hogar y personales, esto lo realiza en sistema de cartillas, ella entrega sus productos de acuerdo a un numero que les toca a sus clientes y estos van pagando cada ocho días, lleva más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa de todo tipo y artículos para el hogar. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son que su negocio mejore aun más y tener algún día un local.
texts.en:
The members of the 'El Almendro' communal bank meet every fortnight in the city of Portoviejo. This group is mainly made up of poor hard-working people who are striving to bring up their families. 

This is where Viviana lives. She is 25 years old and is married but does not have any children yet. Her husband makes a living selling construction materials.

Viviana is a very determined woman who works in retail in order to get on in life. She sells clothing, personal items and items for the home. She sells these through a savings book system. She supplies the goods according to a numbers system whereby the customers take it in turns, making payments every week. She has been doing this for more than 4 years and is making progress in life. 

She will use the loan to buy all kinds of clothing and items for the home. She has been in the communal bank from the beginning and likes it because of the help she gets with the loans.

Her dream is to improve her business even more and to have a sales outlet one day.

loans.use: to buy clothing and items for the home.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: This is Asha. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for supporting her financially. She still sells food stuffs and also operates a retail shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a widowed woman with six children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread and beans. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, pain tablets, blood syrup and cholera drugs to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, baking flour, beans, plates and other cooking utensils.

loans.name: Lisbon Group

texts.en:
Saida is a divorcee and a mother of three schooling children. She is aged in her forties. She has been taking care of her family herself since she divorced. She is involved with electrical issues, in which she manages a shop selling electrical fittings, bulbs, sockets, wires, etc. 

Despite being a woman, she is involved with work which is normally expected to be done by men. She repairs defective electrical equipment like brander (juicers), cooling fans, etc. She works hard every day to increase her income and make her family life better. Saida is in her shop from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

Saida is requesting a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock her shop with more new electrical items to meet her customers' demand, and generally speaking, she improved her shop. She paid back successfully all previous loans. With a good job, she received an extra income which she used to cover medical and food expenses and school fees. Saida dreams that one day she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a nice house for her family. She will use this credit to buy shop stock to resell. 

Saida will share this loan with her loan group, "LISBON," which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy shop stock to resell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a married woman with four school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Asma has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es:
Santos tiene 31 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado ya que en ese momento el estudio no se veía como una prioridad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa y al cuido y atención de sus 3 hijos.

Desde su juventud, Santos se dedicó al trabajo agrícola con su padre quien le enseñó este trabajo, ahora ya tiene 10 años d trabajar independientemente en la siembra de granos básicos para tener alimento en su casa siempre, además se dedica a la prestación de seguridad pública como soldado.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y pesticidas para las labores que demanda el cultivo, ademas pagará la instalación de agua potable. 

El planea que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda mejorar su casa, sacar adelante a sus hijos, que puedan prepararse dedicadamente, además espera tener una buena cosecha que le rinda buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old. He studied until the third grade since at that time study was not seen as a priority. He is in a relationship and his partner is engaged in keeping the home and attending to their 3 children.

From his youth, Santos has made a living from agricultural work with his father who taught him this job. Now, he has already worked for 10 years independently sowing basic grains to always have food in the house. Furthermore, he makes a living from the provision of public security as a soldier.

He needs the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for the work that the crops need. Furthermore, he will pay for the installation of drinking water.

He plans in the not very far future to improve his home, bring his children out ahead so that they can prepare themselves dedicatedly, and also he hopes to have a good harvest that renders good profits.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for the work that the crops need, plus pay for the installation of drinking water.

loans.name: Rosa Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito El Almendro. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y 13 años, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido trabaja en un taller de automóviles. 
Doña Rosa es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta productos Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día. Ella también fabrica tortas bajo pedido una o dos veces a la semana con lo cual se gana algo extra. Tiene tres años que se dedica a estas actividades y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y víveres para elaborar las tortas. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, every fifteen days the members of the credit group El Almendro meet. This group is mostly made up of humble and hard-working people who struggle to help their families get ahead.

Here lives Rosa. She is 38 years old and is in a civil union from which she has two children, 18 and 13 years old. The younger one studies in school. Her husband works in a car repair shop.

Rosa is a homemaker who to make her own income and with it helps her husband with home expenses. She makes a living selling Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works three days a week for two or three hours each day. She also makes cakes on order one or two times a week with which she makes a little extra money. She has made a living from these activities for three years and it is going very well for her. What she sells the most are perfumes and cosmetics since they are very good.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and supplies to create the cakes. This is the third cycle in the credit group, and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and supplies.

loans.name: Mwamtoto

texts.en:
Mwamtoto is married with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwamtoto has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to town dwellers and neighbors.  

Mwamtoto is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children who are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years, she has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loans, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce is a repeat client, age 32 years old and married. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to improve her banana plantations through adding more manure, like decomposing grass and cow dung. Her source of income is selling matooke (bananas) from her banana plantation so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan which she hopes will help to improve her yields and productivity. Loyce hopes this will increase her income and she will be able to meet her family's needs and pay school fees for her children so that they can study well without interruptions.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María tiene 63 años de edad, asistió hasta primer grado a la escuela, se casó y formaron una familia de tres hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con ella, su esposo falleció y ella quedó al cuidado de su hijos pero en su casa ya solo hay una hija pues los demás ya se casaron, con ella vive su yerno y dos nietos.
Ella tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace mas de 20 años, negocio al que decidió dedicarse en vista que sus vecinos caminaban grandes distancias para comprar los productos necesarios y de consumo en el hogar, además es sastre y confecciona lindas prendas de vestir, su puesto de trabajo lo tiene en su casa, su yerno y su hija atienden los clientes en los momentos que ella no puede.

El negocio de María marcha bien pero aún no tiene algunos productos que los clientes le demandan por eso solicita financiamiento para surtir más su tienda con diferentes productos necesarios y de consumo para el hogar, teniendo una tienda bien surtida sus vecinos podrán encontrar las cosas con más accesibilidad.
Ella espera tener más ganancias de las que ya tiene y seguir invirtiendo para que su tienda sea grande pues sueña con ser una gran comerciante, además desea poder ayudar a su nietos para que se preparen académicamente y tengan una mejor vida en el futuro; ella está bien segura que el préstamo le ayudará a aprovechar esta oportunidad de negocio.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old. She went to school until the first grade. She married and had three children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband passed away and she had to look after her children. Only her one daughter still lives with her, as her other children have married. Her son-in-law and two grandchildren also live with her.

María has had a small store for more than 20 years now. She started this business when she noticed that her neighbors had to walk long distances to buy basic necessities for the home. María is also a seamstress and makes beautiful pieces of clothing. She works from home, and her son-in-law and daughter look after the customers when she is unable to.

María's business is going well, but she does not have some products that her customers ask for. For this reason she is requesting this loan to stock her store with a variety of products and basic necessities for the home. She hopes that with her store better stocked, her neighbors will be able to find the products they want more easily.

María hopes to improve her profit and to continue investing in her store so that it grows. She dreams of being a successful merchant. She also would like to be able to help her grandchildren so that they can prepare themselves academically and have a better life in the future. María is confident that this loan will help her to capture this opportunity for her business.

loans.use: to stock her store with a variety of products and basic necessities for the home.

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 61 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen en común 3 hijos, todos viven con ellos en casa y estudian nivel básico.


Rogelio se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años en este rubro, ya que desde pequeño le enseñó la actividad su padre pues ha sido una familia que se ha dedicado a eso para salir adelante. Además, Rogelio trabaja como jornal en las temporadas que no está trabajando la agricultura, realiza crianza y comercialización de reces y venta de leche y queso. El trabajo agrícola lo desempeña durante 6 horas diarias.



El crédito lo necesita para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas y foliares entre otros productos necesarios para cultivar el maíz y el maicillo que desea sembrar. 


Sus sueños son  seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y es la agricultura pues ha sido el pilar que le ha permitido sacar a delante a su familia y que sus hijos estén estudiando.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 61 years old and studied as far as sixth grade. He has a partner and she looks after the house. They have had 3 children together and they all live with them in their house and go to primary school. Rogelio makes a living from agriculture and has been doing this for 20 years. He learnt the skills from his father from a young age, as they have always been a  family who have worked in farming in order to get on in life. 

Rogelio also works as a day labourer at times when he is not working in agriculture. He raises and sells cattle and sells milk and cheese. He carries out his agricultural work for 6 hours a day.

He needs the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, weedkiller and foliar feeds among other products which are needed for growing the corn and sorghum he wants to plant.

His dream is to continue working at what he enjoys, which is agriculture, as this has been the foundation which has enabled him to bring up his family and give his children an education.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, weedkiller and foliar feeds needed for growing the corn and sorghum he wants to plant.

loans.name: Dominic Habu

texts.en:
Dominic Habu is a 25-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Dominic Habu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dominic Habu can earn up to $2,000 a hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dominic Habu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season due to the inputs he will obtain with this loan. He is most excited about the improved seeds because of their high yield potential.  

When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to educate my children, Clement, Malki-Sadic and Ummi. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” 

With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic baskets, buckets, bowls and dish sets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of sardines and Maggi seasoning

loans.name: Tanimu Umar

texts.en: Tanimu Umar is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Tanimu Umar joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ashafa, Surajo, and  Umar. Tanimu Umar is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Tanimu Umar will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products such as sand. Due to this loan, Tanimu will be able to access high quality inputs. As a result, he is hoping to reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/hectare, which is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to build a better home.” Tanimu Umar is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long term goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
This is Mwanahawa. She previously accessed a loan that she used in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase weaves, hair oil, and shampoos for her business. She appreciates Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart

loans.use: to purchase weaves, hair oil, and shampoos for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  29 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIONCOURANI,  commune de KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec PASCALINE  1ère personne deboute à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau de  KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte faire un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi III are married women with an average age of 29 years and an average of three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Tioncourani in the commune of Kadiana, Kolondieba Cercle, one of the prefectures of the third largest administrative region of Mali.

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

Pascaline grows rice and peanuts. She is the first person standing at the right of the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, and to pay for the labor to work one hectare. After the harvest, she sells her crops in Kadiana to both men and women. She expects to earn a profit of 50,000 XOF, which will allow her to repay the loan and also help her husband with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds for her rice and peanut crops, and to pay for the labor to work one hectare.

loans.name: Isatu P

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Isatu P. She is divorced and has five children, aged 35, 30, 21, 19 and 17 years; three are school-going children. She has three additional dependents, who live with her to attend school and help in domestic affairs.  

In 1974, Isatu P. established her business in rubber drums, rubber bowls, set-pants (dishes), baskets and Africana clothes in men's and women's designs. She began her business because she stopped at primary level due to the death of her mother and lack of support from her father; she started assisting her elder sister in doing her business. The profit she generated was shared between them and later she started her own rice business. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 8,820,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Isatu P. requires a loan in order to buy dozens of rubber drums, bowls, set pans, baskets and Africana clothes for men and women. 

In the future, Isatu P. plans to complete her building project, rent a shop and educate her children to university level. Inadequate capital is her main challenge, as well as frequent increases in prices and sometimes, low sales. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of rubber drums, bowls, pan sets, baskets and Africana clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more used bags for resale.

loans.name: Vuyokazi

texts.en:
Vuyokazi is applying for a second loan to support her studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“My first Kiva loan helped me a lot in continuing with my studies. Coming to school daily has been easy. I am grateful to Kiva!”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Keketso

texts.en:
Keketso is applying for a second loan to support her studies through to graduation in December 2014 at the Maharishi Institute. She has provided the following update on her progress since receiving the first loan:

“I am very thankful for the first loan that I received from Kiva to cover the tuition fees and monthly living expenses. I don’t have financial problems, which I had before receiving the Kiva loan.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
The three members of the Discipline group are married women and they are, on average, 35 years old with two children each. They live in traditional families in Chorkor-Accra, a working-class neighborhood.

In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their fourth loan cycle with the microfinance institution ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have all been duly repaid.

Grace, a member of the group, sells bags and slippers. In the photo, she is standing left. She is planning to use her loan to buy more bags and slippers to sell to customers. She sells to both men and women and payment is in cash. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, part of which will be used to repay her loan, while the rest will go into savings.

They thank ID-Ghana, Kiva's field partner, who has been helping them to sustain their businesses until now.

loans.use: to buy more bags and slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Danlami

texts.en: Danlami is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Danlami joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Anas, Basiru, and   Kamsisi. Danlami is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Danlami will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Danlami can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2000/hectare which is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland.” Danlami is not thinking about this year alone. He expressed that his long-term goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in alpaca apparel and accessories. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of fine alpaca wool for his designs. Alberto has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "I feel very proud to be able to contribute to the development of my country as I work with more than 20 artisan associations. Working on traditional handlooms, their craftsmanship is impeccable, and of the quality required by the international market. We want to preserve the traditions that began hundreds of years ago during the days of the Inca Empire. "I would like to thank you all for making this opportunity available to me. The microcredit will be of great assistance, and will help further my goal of helping to keep people around the world nice and warm in my alpaca garments!" Use the link below to view Alberto's alpaca apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7484

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of fine alpaca wool for his designs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Sani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ismaila, Abdullahi, and  Wasila. Sani is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Sani will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Sani can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14, and earn up to $2000/hectare which is more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money to expand my farmland.” Sani is not thinking about this year alone. He expressed that his long-term goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: to access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over-sewing machine and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.ru:
Мелинда не замужем. Она проживает в квартире вместе с матерью.
Миленда работает оператором производственного отделения. Она трудолюбивая и заботливая. Самой большой трудностью для ее семьи была потеря отца. В доме, где проживает Миленда, протекает крыша. На кухне промокли стены и потолок.

Миленда просит предоставить кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на ремонт кухни. Она хочет покрасить и прошпаклевать стены, а также положить на потолок гипсокартон.
texts.en:
Melinda is not married. She lives in an apartment with her mother. 

Melinda works in manufacturing. She is hardworking and caring. The biggest challenge for her family has been the loss of her father. The roof in Melinda's house leaks. The walls and ceiling in the kitchen got wet.  

Melinda has requested a loan of 6,000 hryvnia to renovate her kitchen. She wants to plaster and paint the walls and drywall the ceiling.

loans.use: fix leaks in her kitchen

loans.name: Setu

texts.en:
Setu is a 39-year-old divorced woman with five children. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Setu needs a loan to buy cases of chicken, mutton flaps, boxes of sausages, soy sauce, tongs, chinese onions and a large pot. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Setu has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cases of chicken, mutton flaps, boxes of sausages, soy sauce, tongs, chinese onions and a large pot

loans.name: Jesús Ana

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 72 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y es madre de dos hijos los cuales ya se acompañaron, también con ella vive su esposo quien se dedica a trabajos d mecánica algunos nietos viven en casa pero no dependen de Jesús. 

Ella tiene un tienda desde hace mas de 25 años,  se dedica a esto porque es una actividad económicamente rentable y le va muy bien pues siempre obtiene buenas ganancias, su tienda empieza  funcionar a las 6 de la mañana y cierra a las 7 de la noche.

El crédito lo necesita para  invertir mas en su tienda, pues a veces los clientes buscan algunos productos y ella no los tiene dentro de sus inventarios y pierde la oportunidad de vender.

Ella sueña con que su negocio sea grande y basta rentable para así poder ayudar a su nietos y que salgan adelante, que cuenten con la facilidad de estudiar y que lleguen a ser profesionales de éxito en el futuro.
texts.en:
Jesus is 72 years old. She finished third grade. She is married and is mother of two children who are married. She lives with her husband who is dedicated to mechanic work. Some of her grandchildren live in her house but are not financially dependent on Jesus. She has owned a shop for more than 25 years. She is dedicated to this because it is profitable work and it is going very well since she always obtains good income. The store opens at 6 in the morning and closes at 7 at night.

She needs the loan to invest more in her shop since sometimes customers look for some products and she does not have them in her inventory and she loses the opportunity to make a sale.

She dreams that her business becomes big and profitable so she can help her grandchildren get ahead, and that they're able to study and become successful professionals in the future.

loans.use: to invest more in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil and lemon juice from the south of the country to resell.

loans.name: Pingdwend Group

texts.fr:
KOTIME  est responsable du groupe PINGDWEND. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme vend des habits et pagnes depuis plus de 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur.
Mme veut s’acheter 03complets pagnes batik,10douzaines d’habits et 05jupes prêt à porter.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer sa condition de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Kotime is the representative of the PINGDWEND group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is ten, the youngest is two.  One of her children goes to school.

Kotime has been selling "pagnes" (West-African fabrics) and clothes for over two years.  She stocks up at her local market.  She plans to buy three pieces of batik fabrics (each piece measuring 1 x 3 meters), ten dozen clothing items and five skirts.  She wants to reinvest her profits into her business.  Her goal is to expand her activity and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three pieces of batik fabrics, 10 dozen clothing items and five skirts.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.ru: Айбеку 29 лет, женат, есть  дочь. У Айбека среднее образование, с 2005 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря своему трудолюбию и упорству на сегодняшний день у Айбека в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы и 20 овец. Также он занимается полеводством. У Айбека уже есть кредит в Банке "Бай-Тушум", средства которого он вложил в развитие своего полеводческого бизнеса. Но 1 июня 2014 года его бизнес пострадал от сильного града, была разрушена поливная земля Айбека мерою 2,50 ГА, где были посажены арбузы. У Айбека уже наработаны постоянные оптовые клиенты, иногда он сам торгует арбузами на местном рынке. Однако теперь бизнес пострадал и ему необходимо выплачивать кредит, содержать свою семью и восстанавливать бизнес, в связи с этим он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом форс-мажор, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS).  Доход от кредита  в будущем поможет ему снова заняться любимым делом, восстановить свой бизнес, улучшить условия жизни семьи, а также  возможно построить новый дом для своей хоть пока и маленькой, но очень дружной семьи.
texts.en: Aibek is 29 years old, married, and has a daughter. Aibek has a secondary education.  Since 2005 he has worked in agriculture. Thanks to Aibek's diligence and perseverance, the farm currently has two dairy cows and twenty sheep. He also grows crops. Aibek already has taken out one loan from the bank Bai Tushum, which he used to expand his farm. However, on June 1, 2014, his business suffered from severe hail. Two and a half hectares of  irrigated land where Aibek had planted watermelons was destroyed. Aibek has loyal wholesale customers, and sometimes he sells watermelons in the local market himself. Now, however, the business has suffered and he must repay the loan, support his family, and restore his business. Therefore, he appealed to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS for force majeure. The money from the loan will be used to help him do the work he so loves, restore his business, improve his family's living conditions, and possibly build a new house for his currently small, but very friendly, family.

loans.use: To restore business and  repay the loan

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a 28-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells ice cakes and chips in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Selina needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a cooler and foam cups for her ice cakes. She'll also be buying a large frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil and salt for her chips. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Selina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a cooler and foam cups for her ice cakes, and to buy a large frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil and salt for her chips

loans.name: Bismarck Augusto

texts.es:
Por las calles de Granada, se escucha hablar bien sobre la panadería de Bismarck, un hombre amable, trabajador, con muchos deseos de superación. A sus 45 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 4 años de edad, los cuales le motivan para seguir adelante, brindándoles una educación y economía estable. Desde hace ocho años, cuando la suegra de Bismarck les heredó la panadería para seguir con la tradición familiar llena de pasión, se elaboran a diario distintos tipos de postres, panes y reposterías de las manos de esta unida familia. 
Él tiene muchos sueños por delante junto a su esposa y su suegra, pues planean expandirse a otros departamentos, por ejemplo Masaya. Sin embargo para ello necesitan aumentar sus ingresos, por esta razón necesitan de un préstamo para comprar nueva maquinaria, un horno y sartenes  para producir más pan, de mejor calidad y buena higiene. Bismarck sueña con que algún día pueda expandirse a todos los departamentos del país, pero por ahora quiere llegar a todo el mercado de granada.
texts.en:
In the streets of Granada, people speak highly of the bakery belonging to Bismarck, who is kind and hardworking and has a strong desire to get ahead.

Bismarck is 45 years old, married, and has two children, ages 12 and 4. Bismarck's children motivate him to work hard to get ahead and to provide them with an education and a financially-secure home.

Bismarck has for eight years continued the family's tradition of passion for baking, ever since he inherited the bakery from his mother-in-law. Every day this very close-knit family makes a wide variety of desserts, breads and pastries.

Bismarck, along with his wife and mother-in-law, has many dreams for the business, including expanding into other departments, such as Masaya. However, to do so they need to increase their income, and it is for this reason Bismarck is requesting this loan to buy a new oven, machinery and pans. He hopes to produce more bread, of higher quality, and with better hygiene.

Bismarck dreams of one day expanding to all of the departments of the country, but for now he would like to expand to all of the market of Granada.

loans.use: to buy a new oven, machinery and pans for his bakery.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
A los 37 años, muchos de los jóvenes quienes no terminaron su colegio, no tienen todavía una vida económica estable, sin embargo, el arduo trabajo de Karla, hace cambiar esta regla, pues a esta edad, desde hace cinco años es comerciante de ropa, perfume y cremas para la piel, está casada y está a cargo de dos de sus tres hijos.  
Karla cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y su mamá, sin embargo, esta joven comerciante quiere seguir viendo crecer su propio negocio. Por esta razón, es que necesita de un préstamo para comprar más ropa y cosméticos para poder variar sus productos, ofrecer calidad en su trabajo, de manera que podrá ganar mayores ingresos debido a este cambio. Anteriormente Karla había solicitado un préstamo con el cual compró ropa nueva para vender, tras ver los resultados sabe que de esta forma podrá crecer profesionalmente y podrá brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: At 37 many of the youth that didn't complete High school still don't have a stable economic life. However through her hard work Karla has changed this rule. For 5 years she has been a businesswoman selling clothing, perfume and skin. She is married and is responsible for two of her three children. Karla has the support of her husband and her mother and still she wants to see her business continue to grow. For this reason she needs a loan to buy more clothing and cosmetics so she can have more variety in her products. And she can offer more quality too so that she can make more income with this change. Karla requested a loan before and with it she bought new clothes to sell. Seeing the results she knew that this was the way to grow professionally and be able to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and cosmetics to add variety to her products.

loans.name: Sidlawende Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est la responsable du groupe SIDLAWENDE II. Elle se porte très bien ainsi que les autres membres. Marié, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces environnantes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 03 rangées de bois et 06sacs de charbon de bois.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son champ d'activité et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Lamoussa is the representative of the SIDLAWENDE II group.  She, and the other members of the group, are doing very well.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Her oldest child is 15 years old and her youngest is five.  Three of her children go to school.

Lamoussa has been selling firewood and charcoal for the past seven years.  She stocks up in the surrounding provinces.  She plans to buy three cords of firewood and six bags of charcoal.  She wants to reinvest her profits into her activity.  Her goal is to expand her field of activity and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy three cords of wood and six bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Faaleleiga

texts.en:
Faaleleiga is a 30-year-old, married woman, with five children. To earn a living, she makes and sells pancakes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Faaleleiga needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Faaleleiga has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, and a new oven.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el Caserío de Cabramayo en el Distrito de Colasay, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de talado de madera con motocierra, cuenta con clientes de la zona que en la mayoría son carpinteros, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de su equipo que lo que le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the village of Cabramayo in Colasay District, located in Jaén Province, which belongs to Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Jhonny provides a wood cutting service with his chainsaw. He has clients in the area, most of whom are carpenters. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 PEN to maintain his equipment which will allow him to provide better service to his clients.

loans.use: to maintain his work tools.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 44-year-old widow with nine children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years. 

Akenese needs a loan to buy a large wheelbarrow, a farming fork, a spade, fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, crops, a tiller, gloves, and new gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2002. Akenese will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large wheelbarrow, a farming fork, a spade, fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, crops, a tiller, gloves and new gum boots

loans.name: Derci

texts.es:
Derci tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su padre en su propia casa que cuenta con servicios básicos de luz y agua, en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima calurosa, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de plátano y servicio de mano de obra, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de plátano para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Derci is 51 years old. He lives alongside his father in his own house that has basic services like light and water in the Morropon district, a community with a hot climate. Its population is dedicated to farming, trade and livestock and is located in the province with the same name that belongs to the Piura district on the north coast of Peru.

He is dedicated to selling bananas and working as a laborer. He has requested a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternative to buy a greater quantity of bananas to offer to his customers and, in this way, generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of bananas to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Clorinda Yaneth

texts.es:
Una sonrisa cálida y un negocio ordenado, es el ambiente que te recibe al entrar al puesto de venta de ropa usada de Doña Clorinda, sus clientes expresan estar satisfechos por la atención y los productos de calidad que ella ofrece. Tiene 50 años de edad, está soltera y tiene 6 hijos. Con el objetivo de mejorar la economía familiar,  hace dos años estableció su negocio, en el poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante. Una de sus hijas es su mano derecha, es quién le brinda soporte para cumplir sus metas.
Clorinda solicita de un préstamo para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar ropa usada tanto para mujeres como para hombres, desde faldas, camisas hasta pantalones. Es una señora que con el pasar del tiempo se pone más dinámica y trabajadora, su meta es expandir su negocio y establecer otro, uno de venta de comida tradicional nicaragüense.
texts.en:
A warm smile and tidy store is the environment that will greet you when you enter Clorinda's used clothing shop.  Her clients express satisfaction with her service and the quality products she offers.  Clorinda is 50-years-old, single, and has 6 children.  She opened her business two years ago with the objective of improving the family economy, and little by little and with a great deal of effort, she has gotten ahead.  One of her daughters is her right hand and provides the foundation for achieving her goals.  

Clorinda is seeking a loan to increase capital.  She needs to buy used clothing for women as well as men, including skirts, blouses, and pants.  She's a woman who becomes more dynamic and hardworking all the time.  Her goal is to expand her business and open another shop where she can sell traditional Nicaraguan food.

loans.use: to buy used women's as well as men's clothing, from skirts and blouses to pants.

loans.name: Ivania Jamileth

texts.es:
Un grupo de leñas adornaban el patio de Ivania cuando inició su propio negocio, la venta de ella eran una pequeña parte de la fuente de ingresos cuando comenzó, pues su esposo, quien trabaja en Costa Rica, le enviaba remesas. Luego fue agregando galletas y caramelos, hasta que buscó un crédito para  completar su propia pulpería. Desafortunadamente no pudo llegar a la universidad debido a la falta de dinero, sin embargo sigue luchando. Ahora, a sus 34 años de edad, tiene tres años con su propio negocio completo. 
Ivania cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano y el de su esposo desde Costa Rica. Ahora sueña con seguir creciendo con su negocio mediante un préstamo, con el cual piensa comprar más granos básicos como arroz y frijoles entre otros producto, ya que sus clientes demandan mucho este producto. Entre sus otros planes está aumentar sus ventas y crear una cuenta de ahorro para cualquier emergencia.
texts.en:
When she started her own business, firewood adorned Ivania's patio. When she began, selling it was a small part of her source of income since her husband, who works in Costa Rica, sends her remittances. Then she added cookies and candies until she searched for a loan to start her own grocery store. Unfortunately, she could not go to university due to a lack of money. Nevertheless, she kept working hard. Now, at 34 years of age, she has had her own business for three years.

Ivania counts on the support of her brother and her husband from Costa Rica. Now she dreams to keep growing her business through a loan with which she is thinking of buying more basic grains like rice and beans, among other products since her customers request this a lot. Among her other plans is to expand her sales and create a savings account for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more basic grains like rice and beans, among other products.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.ru: Айбеку 44 года, женат, 4 несовершеннолетних детей, которые, несмотря на свой юный возраст с радостью активно помогают по хозяйству. У Айбека среднее образование, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Ранее Айбек обращался в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на развитие полеводческой деятельности. Однако 1 июня 2014 года случилось несчастье, из-за сильного града поливная земля Айбека мерою 1,50 ГА, где были посажены арбузы и 0,50 ГА с уже выросшими дынями была полностью разрушена. Дыни и арбузы пострадали, так и не успев поспеть. А это основной доход Айбека, у него уже наработаны постоянные клиенты и есть рынки сбыта. Теперь же ему необходимо выплачивать кредит и восстанавливать свой бизнес, в связи с этим он обратился  в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Айбек уважаемый  человек, он пунктуален, корректен в общении, имеет большой опыт работы в сельском хозяйстве, знает всю технологию сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Он очень ответственный и предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать средства в нужное направление. Доход от кредита поможет ему встать на ноги после обстоятельств непреодолимой силы, силы природы, и в будущем, собрав новый урожай улучшить уровень жизни семьи. У Айбека есть желание - сделать дома ремонт и обеспечить достойное будущее  своим детям.
texts.en: Aibek is 44 years old and married. Despite their young age, his four children actively and joyfully help on the farm. Aibek has a secondary education. Since 2000, he has kept livestock and farmed. Aibek previously took out a loan from Bai Tushum to expand his farm. However,  on June 1, 2014, there was an accident. Strong hail completely destroyed Aibek's irrigated land, 1.50 hectares of watermelons and 0.50 hectares of mature melon plants.  The melons and watermelons suffered and did not get a chance to ripen. This is Aibek's primary source of income. He has regular customers and sales at the market. Now he must repay his loan and rebuild his business. Therefore, he asked the bank Bai Tushum for a loan of 100,000 KGS. Aibek is a respected man. He is punctual, polite, and has extensive experience in agriculture. He knows all about the technology of agriculture. He is very responsible and enterprising, able to properly run a farm and invest wisely. Money from the loan will help him get back on his feet after the force majeure, this act of nature. In the future, he will plant a new crop to improve his family's standard of living. Aibek's wish is to repair his home and ensure a decent future for his children.

loans.use: restore his business

loans.name: Abubakari

texts.en:
Abubakari is a master wood carver in Ghana who specializes in wood masks and sculptures. He would like to purchase raw materials in bulk for his designs.

Abubakari has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"My interest in the arts and carvings started at a very tender age, as I was fascinated by pieces of wood and calabashes. Because of the strict work ethics of 'do it best the first time,' my carving tutor never graduated any of his students until he was sure that he was sending out a good carver. For this reason, I spent five years under his tutelage. With good planning, I started saving a little monies towards expanding my workshop."

"This microcredit will help me to produce more designs as, at the moment, I have been unable to raise funds for the production of any new items. Thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Abubakari's hand-carved African masks, sculptures and drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3131

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in bulk for his designs.

loans.name: Ivette Carolina

texts.es:
Tras haber alistado a su pequeño hijo para ir a clases, Ivette empieza a preparar la deliciosa comida que vende en su pequeña pulpería, no hay persona que se resista al exquisito olor que se desprende de su cocina, razón principal por la que todos recurren a ella para saciar su hambre. Tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera. Hace cinco años inició a vender comida, aprovechó una de sus habilidades de cocina para poder salir adelante. Su principal apoyo ha sido su familia, quienes día a día la motivan a salir adelante.
Ivette solicita de un préstamo para incrementar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar granos básicos así como arroz y frijoles; al mismo tiempo, verduras, pollo, carne de res y cerdo, entre otros. Es una mujer emprendedora y una madre ejemplar, desea brindarle a su hijo salud y educación de calidad. Una de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y la de su negocio, su objetivo es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
After she gets her young son ready to go to school, Ivette begins to prepare the delicious food she sells in her small store. No one can resist the exquisite smells that come from her kitchen, which is the principal reason why everyone runs to buy her delicious food.

Ivette is 28 years old and is a single mother.

Five years ago she started selling prepared food, using some of her skills in the kitchen to work to get ahead.

Her principal support has come from her family, who each day motivate her to get ahead.

Ivette is requesting this loan to increase her production, for which she needs to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, as well as vegetables, chicken, beef and pork, among others.

She is an entrepreneur and a model mother. She wants to give her son good health and a quality education.

One of her goals is to make some improvements to the infrastructure of her house and business, and to keep making progress.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, as well as vegetables, chicken, beef and pork for her business.

loans.name: Leauta

texts.en:
Leauta is 49 years old and married with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Leauta needs a loan to buy a machete, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, a farming form, crops, new overalls and gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Leauta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a machete, a crowbar, a wheelbarrow, a farming form, crops, new overalls and gum boots

loans.name: Vanuvanu

texts.en: Vanuvanu is a 39-year-old single woman with five children. She makes and sells pancakes and chicken pies in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Vanuvanu needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, large basins, yeast, chicken meat and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Vanuvanu has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy a new oven and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo, en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Zaña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, biscochos y galletitas que ella misma prepara, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos como harina, polvo de hornear y manteca vegetal que le permita la preparación del mismo y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leyla, age 27, lives in the family house with her husband.  She lives in a large community in an urban area of Zaña.  She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors.  The inhabitants in her area work in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She makes and sells bread, biscuits, and cookies.  She makes them herself. Her business is located at her home.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles to buy supplies like flour, baking powder, and vegetable shortening.  These supplies will allow her to prepare the baked goods to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for baking.

loans.name: Maribel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maribel del Socorro tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en el Distrito de la Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha morada, actividad que realiza hace más de 05 años, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz que es materia prima para la elaboración de la misma y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel del Socorro is 28 and married.  She lives in Matanza District, Morropon Province, in the region of Piura on the north coast of Peru.   The people there earn their living in agriculture, cattle farming, and business.  Maribel has basic services like water and electricity.  

She has been selling purple corn punch for more than 5 years and has a steady clientele.  She is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 2000 soles to buy corn, the main ingredient for the punch, so she can earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn for making purple punch.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 27-year-old, married woman, with four children. To earn a living, she makes and sells ice cakes in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Jacinta needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, Chinese candy, foam cups, a large spoon, a new chest freezer, and a cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Jacinta has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, Chinese candy, foam cups, a large spoon, a new chest freezer, and a cooler.

loans.name: Songre Group

texts.fr:
NIENKOUN est responsable du groupe SONGRE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est âgé de 06ans et va à l’école. Elle a 02personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du savon et de l’eau glacée depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
 Mme veut s’acheter 04sacs de savon kabakourou et 05cartons de savons parfumé. 
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne maintenant ouvrir une grande boutique alimentaire et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en: NIENKOUN is the official of the group SONGRE. She is well. She is a married mother of one child, who is 6 years old and attending school. She has two persons to support. NIENKOUN has been selling soaps and ice water for six years. She gets her supplies from a market in her area. She wants to purchase 4 bags of kabakourou soap and 5 boxes of perfumed soaps. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition now is to open a large grocery store and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of kabakourou soap and some perfumed soaps

loans.name: Somsoore Iigroup

texts.fr:
Mr SOUMAILA est la responsable du groupe SOMSOORE II. Marié,  il est père d’01 enfant  âgé de 06mois. Sur la photo, il est en tee shirt rouge et présente une chemise. Il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr vend des prêts à porter depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont hommes.
Il veut s’acheter 02 douzaines de chemises et 20 paires de pantalon.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il souhaite étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Soumaila is the representative of the SOMSOORE II group.  He is married and the father of a six-month-old child.  In the photo, he is the man wearing a red T-shirt and showing a shirt.  He has two dependents.

Soumaila has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for five years.  He stocks up at his local market.  His customers are all men.  He wants to buy two dozen shirts and 20 pairs of pants.  He wants to reinvest his profits into his activity.  He would like to expand his business and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy two dozen shirts and 20 pairs of pants.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 40-year-old, married woman, with three children. To earn a living, she owns and operates a canteen, where she sells sandwiches, pies, scones, snacks, and soft drinks. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Penina needs a loan to buy loaves of bread, butter, canned tuna, mayonnaise, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, and plastic bags. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Penina has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread, butter, canned tuna, mayonnaise, bags of flour, yeast, cooking oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Laloleisu

texts.en: Laloleisu is 55 years old and married with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Laloleisu needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, a new wheelbarrow, a machete and new gum boots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Laloleisu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her farm

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
Cada día es una nueva oportunidad para seguir progresando en la vida, asegura María Teodora, una mujer que cada mañana tras haber tomado su cafecito caliente, sale a las calles principales de su comunidad a ofrecer la ropa tanto de niños como de adultos que vende. Tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, todos mayores e independientes. Hace quince años con el objetivo de apoyar en la economía familiar, decidió establecer su pequeño negocio, en el que poco a poco ha logrado progresar. Junto a su esposo luchan por mejorar las condiciones de vida.
María solicita el segundo crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, ella requiere comprar ropa tanto para niños como para adultos, desde ropa interior hasta camisas y pantalones. Manifiesta estar agradecida con el primer financiamiento de KIVA  a través de MiCrédito, con el que logró alcanzar una clientela más amplia y al mismo tiempo  adquirió buenas ganancias. Es una mujer humilde y trabajadora. Su meta es seguir prosperando y lograr un futuro seguro y tranquilo.
texts.en:
"Each day is a new opportunity to continue to progress in life" assures María Teodora, a woman who every morning after having her hot coffee heads to the main streets of her community to offer children's and adult's clothing for sale.

She is 59 years old, married and has 4 children all of them adult and independent. Fifteen years ago with the idea of helping support the family economy she decided to establish her small business, with which little by little she has been able to progress. Together with her husband she strives to improve their living conditions.

María is requesting a second loan to increase the productivity of her capital. She needs to buy clothing for children as well as adults from underwear to shirts and pants. She says that she is grateful for the first loan from Kiva through MiCrédito. She managed to gain a larger clientele with it and at the same time made good money. She is a humble woman and hard-working. Her goal is to continue to prosper and enjoy a secure and quiet future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children as well as for adults like underwear, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge, hija y nieta en su propia casa en el Sector La Otra Banda – Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un carrito sanguchero para diversificar sus productos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sofia, age 54, lives with her husband, her daughter, and her granddaughter in her own house in the La Otra Banda Sector - Zaña.  It is a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and with livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells basic needs products like groceries.  Her business is located at her house.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles to buy a sandwich cart in order to diversify her products.  This way she will generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben, who works alongside his wife, Gilda, is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in jade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade.

Ruben has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"Our story begins in a town near Antigua. Gilda grew up in a home of woodcarvers, and I grew up in a family of silversmiths. We began our first steps as artisans while still going to school. We met when we were 16 years old, both very young and very much in love. We are artisans who work with our hearts, with dedication and love."

"Greetings, friends! We feel very happy and greatly supported thanks to this microcredit, which will help us to continue crafting and doing what we love."

Use the link below to view Ruben and Gilda's handcrafted jade jewelry and Maya masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8685

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade.

loans.name: Kiswendsida Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM représente le groupe KISWENDSIDA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 04vont à l’école.
Elle est restauratrice depuis  03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz et 01bidon d’huile.
Mme veut épargner ses  bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un restaurant et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the KISWENDSIDA group.  She is married and the mother of four children who all go to school.  Her oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is five. 

Mariam has been preparing and selling dishes for three years.  She buys her supplies at her local market.  She wants to buy two bags of rice and one can of oil.  She plans to save her profits.  Her ambition is to open a restaurant and to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and one can of oil.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana de 62 años de edad, solamente estudio primer grado, se encuentra casada, vive junto a su esposo, solamente ellos viven en la casa, Ana tiene una venta de pan, trabajo al cual se ha dedicado desde hace 25 años, lo aprendió de una amiga de ahí dependen sus ingresos y gracias a ello mantiene su hogar. 

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de harina de trigo, margarina, levadura, aceite y otros preparativos para la elaboración de pan, el sueño de Ana es mejorar su negocio, obtener mejores ganancias llevar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 62 years old, only studied to first grade, and is married. She lives together with her husband, and only they live in their house. 

Ana sells bread, work she has done for 25 years. She learned it from a friend, and her income is dependent upon it, thanks to which she maintains her home. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of wheat flour, margarine, yeast, oil, and other ingredients for the making of bread. Ana's dream is to improve her business, earn more, and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, margarine, yeast, oil, and other ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Filisita

texts.en:
Filisita is a 35-year-old, single woman with no children. To earn a living, she runs a small canteen in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. 

Filisita needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, twisties, plastic plates, foam cups, plastic bags, and soft drinks. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Filisita has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, twisties, plastic plates, foam cups, plastic bags, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leata

texts.en: Leata is a 33-year-old single woman with three children. She makes and sells ice cakes and pop corn in her community to earn a living, and she has three years of experience with this business.
