Leata needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a chest freezer, foam cups, corn, cooking oil, a deep pot and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Leata has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her snack business

loans.name: Mariana Leo

texts.en:
Mariana is a 34-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She has a small lawn mowing business to earn a living. She has 2 years in this business.

Mariana needs a loan to buy a new lawnmower, new spark plugs, a pulling cord, petrol, and new overalls. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Mariana joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new lawn mower, new spark plugs, a pulling cord, petrol, and new overalls

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo de Crédito El Almendro. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años que estudia en jardín de infantes. El marido es chofer.
Doña Alexandra es una mujer muy luchadora que por el bienestar de su familia hace lo que sea, ella trabaja por contrato en el Ministerio de Salud Pública donde gana un sueldo mensual en esta institución,  también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta en sus ratos libres y también vende en su trabajo ya que sus compañeras son sus mejores clientes, ella lleva más de 2 años dedicada al comercio con el que sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace dos ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the El Almendro credit group get together. Most members of this group are modest and hardworking people who are fighting to better their families' lives. 

Alexandra lives in Portoviejo and is 32 years old. She lives with her common-law husband, with whom she has a four-year-old son who is in preschool. Her husband works as a driver. 

Alexandra is a very hardworking woman who does whatever she can for her family's well-being. She works for the Ministry of Public Health, where she earns a monthly salary. She also works in sales, selling all types of clothing door to door in her free time. She also sells clothing at work, because her coworkers are some of her best customers. She has been working in sales for two years and this has helped her to better her situation.

Alexandra will use this loan to buy more merchandise, including pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been a part of this credit group for two loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are a great help. Her dream is to do the best she can by her family.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 51-year-old woman who is married with eight children. She earns a living with a small tailoring business, which she has been running for two years. Litia needs a loan to buy thread, needles, a new sewing machine, material, a table and a new pair of scissors. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help expand her business. Litia joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy supplies and equipment for her tailoring business

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, viven en casa propia en el Centro Poblado de Laynas, una zona rural del Distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, comida y crianza de animales menores, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos que le permitan abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 26 years old, is in a relationship, and has three children who go to school. She and her family live in their own house in the municipality of Centro Poblado de Laynas, which is a rural area of La Matanza District. The population of this area works in agriculture, commerce and livestock. The area is located in Morropon Province, in Piura Region, on the northern cost of Peru.

Hermelinda works selling chicha de jora [a traditional corn liquor] and prepared food, as well as raising small animals. She has had this business for three years, and she operates it out of the back of her home. She has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger quantities of ingredients to stock her business. She hopes to improve her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of ingredients for her prepared food business.

loans.name: Yuliana Araceli

texts.es:
Yuliana Araceli tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima calurosa, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio y ranchos por fiestas, además vende golosinas, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza que le permita a bastecer su negocio y de esta amnera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yuliana Araceli is 36 years old and lives in Buenos Aires district, located in Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region on Peru's north coast. It is a community with a hot climate, and the people who live there engage in agriculture, run businesses, and raise livestock.

She sells beer from her home, and at farms for parties. In addition she sells candy. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of beer, which will allow her to stock her business and this way generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy beer for stocking her business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor gabriel es una persona sencilla, humilde, vive en concubinato con su pareja desde hace dos años con la cual tiene un hijo, ambos alcanzaron estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su principal actividad es el servicio de albañil, trabaja de lunes a sábado muchas veces hasta los días domingos para mantener a su familia, es una persona  pobre, no tiene casa propia solo vive en anticrético tiene unos pocos muebles y enseres que no tienen mucho valor, su pareja es ama de casa, él es una persona trabajadora y responsable, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un  crédito para capital de operaciones para la compra de ganado para engorde, de esa manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Gabriel is a simple, humble person who has lived in a common-law relationship with his spouse for two years with whom he has a son. Both of them managed to complete their Primary education. His principal occupation is being a bricklayer. He works from Monday to Saturday and often on Sundays to support his family. He is a poor person. He does not live in his own house but rents. He has little furniture and belongings that have little value. His wife is a housewife. He is a hardworking and responsible person. He is now requesting a loan to have the operating capital to buy cattle to fatten. In this way he can improve the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Alsina

texts.en:
A loan of USD 800 has been offered to Alsina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, eggs, oil, water, body loosener, bread and shampoo. 

Alsina has been in business since 2005. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Alsina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, oil, water, body loosener, bread and shampoo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and fatten pigs and calves.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es:
Dorila tiene 70 años de edad, vive con sus nietos, en casa familiar, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, ubicad en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y menestras, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la para interior del mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 200 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dorila is 70 years old. She lives with her grandchildren in the family home in a large community in the urban zone of Cayalti located in the Chiclayo province that belongs to the Lamayeque region on the north coast of Peru. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors,

She has been dedicated to selling vegetables and legumes for many years. Her business is located in the interior of the district market. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for PEN 2200 to buy groceries to stock her business and thus generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 68 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en casa propia que cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz) en una comunidad de Buenos Aires de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de plátano comercio y crianza de animales menores, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y chica de jora, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flora is 68 years old and married. She lives in her own home, which has running water and electricity, in Buenos Aires district, located in Morropon province, which is part of the Piura region on Peru's north coast. It is a community with a hot climate, and the people who live there engage in agriculture (especially the cultivation of plantains), run businesses, and raise small animals.

She sells beer and corn beer chicha. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of beer for stocking her store, and thereby selling it to her customers.

loans.use: Compra de cerveza para abastecer su negocio.

loans.name: Koleta

texts.en:
Koleta is a 62-year-old widow with six children. She has a small vegetable garden, where she grows cabbages and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. 

Koleta needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, insect poison, fertilizer, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, and a tiller. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2003. Koleta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, insect poison, fertilizer, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, and a tiller.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more of the ingredients needed in her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her child. Her income from business is assisting their everyday needs. As a widow, she works hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Flora dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family is always in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, such as rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Cherylen

texts.en:
Cherylen works hard to support her family. Cherylen is married and has a retail nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

Cherylen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more nipa roofing to sell to her customers.

Cherylen has been in this business for five years now.

Cherylen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Josephine has a upholstery business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, foam, etc. for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, foam, etc. for her business

loans.name: Blanca Aracely

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 38 años de edad, solo estudió hasta tercer grado  ya que la escuela le quedaba muy lejos, eso le dificultó poder seguir estudiando, está acompañada y sus hijos dependen económicamente de ella, su pareja actual es empleado y brinda asistencia técnica en una institución, tiene 4 hijos pero solo tres asisten a la escuela.

Ella siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora, por mas de 10 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sus padres fueron los que le enseñaron este trabajo además en su casa tiene una pupuseria que también le genera ingresos, su cultivo está a 3 km de su casa, camina 40 minutos para llegar trabaja casi todo los días,  sus hijas la acompañan y su esposo cuando no está trabajando.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono y pesticidas para aplicarlos a la milpa y así obtener una buena cosecha y por ende el alimento siempre estará disponible en su casa.

Ella sueña con tener un buen cultivo, que la cosecha sea grande,  además ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente y con las ganancias obtenidas de este financiamiento volver a invertir en la próxima temporada agrícola.
texts.en:
Blanca is 38 years old and only studied through the third grade because she lived far from the school and this made it difficult for her to continue. She lives with her partner, who works in technical support in an organization, and has four children who depend on her financially, three of whom are in school.

Blanca has always been someone who fights for what she wants. She has worked in farming for more than 10 years, having learned how to work the land from her parents. She also runs a stand selling pupusas (a traditional El Salvadorean dish) from her home for extra income. The land she works is 3 kilometers from her house and nearly every day she walks for 40 minutes to work in the fields. Her children go with her and so does her partner when he is not working.

Blanca needs this loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her fields so that she can have a good harvest and therefore plenty of food at home. She hopes the harvest will be plentiful, and wants to help her children to be well-prepared in school. She plans to reinvest any income she will make thanks to this loan in the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru: Раисе 59 лет, разведена, есть сын, который проживает вместе с матерью. У Раисы высшее образование, по специальности биолог, работала учителем биологии в школе, затем 17 лет проработала агрономом, а также 5 лет химиком по охране природы, сейчас Раиса на пенсии и занимается сельским хозяйством. Главной ценностью жизни она считает благополучие своей семьи, процветание бизнеса и счастье сына.  Благодаря целеустремленности, трудолюбию и нацеленности на результат Раисы, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы, 1 нетель. Дополнительно Раиса занимается полеводством, выращивая на своем участке мерою 0,24 ГА эспарцет и картофель, а на приусадебном участке в 0,61 ГА - 130 корней смородины. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Раиса обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для покупки бычков и минеральных удобрений. Она намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Раиса планирует вложить в женитьбу сына и хочет помочь ему в развитии собственного бизнеса - автомастерской.
texts.en: Raisa is 59, divorced, and has one son who lives with her. She has a college degree in biology and used to be a biology teacher. Then she worked as an agronomist for 17 years and as an environmental chemist for 5 years. Now she is retired and works in agriculture. Her main priorities in life are her family's well-being, business prosperity, and her son's happiness. Thanks to her dedication, hard work, and determination, Raisa now has three cows and one heifer. She also plants sainfoin and potatoes on a 0.24 hectare plot of land and has a 0.61 hectare garden with 130 currant plants. She earns about 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Raisa applied for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy steers and fertilizers. She intends to increase her number of livestock in order to earn a larger income for her family. She will use the profits to save for her son's wedding and to help him open  a car repair shop.

loans.use: To buy steers and fertilizers

loans.name: Rofina

texts.en: A USD 800 loan is offered to Rofina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as soap, shampoo, oils, noodles, and cigarettes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy soap, shampoo, oils, noodles, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married. 

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as body lotion, beer, eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. 

She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people to improve living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, beer, eggs, shampoo, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and slippers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is taking out a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is married with four children and is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, eggs, coffee, body loosen, oils and rice. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. Julieta is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil soltero, vive en el Caserío Talanquera, una comunidad rural del distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta por pedido a Huancabamba, actividad que realiza hace más de 02 años, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de banano y naranjas pedido a proveedores en chacra y posteriormente ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Abel is 27 years old, single, and lives in Caserío Talanquera, a rural community in Morropon district located in the province of the same name, which is part of the Piura region on Peru's north coast. 

He sells fruit by order in Huancabamba, a business he has carried on for more than two years, and for which he has an established clientele.
He has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of bananas and oranges ordered from farmers, to later sell to his customers, generating greater income for his family.

loans.use: To buy bananas and oranges for stocking his business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos y patos, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales de corral para engorde y posteriormente ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Teresa is 26 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Zaña district of the Chiclayo province. Chiclayo is part of the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, trade and cattle-raising.

Teresa makes a living raising and selling young animals, such as pigs and ducks. Teresa runs this business out of the back of her home. Teresa has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy farm animals to fatten up and later sell to customers for a better price.

loans.use: to buy farm animals to fatten up.

loans.name: Yeny Margarita

texts.es:
Yeny Margarita tiene 42años de edad, vive con sus dos menores hijas, en el Sector La Melchora, una zona rural del Distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yeny Margarita is 42 years old and lives with her two young daughters. Yeny lives in the La Melchora sector, a rural area in the Cayalti district of Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people work in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Yeny makes a living raising and selling young animals at the back of her house. Yeny has applied for a loan of 2501 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" to buy animal feed in order to fatten up young animals. This will allow Yeny to earn a higher living for her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed in order to fatten up young animals.

loans.name: Estila

texts.en:
Estila is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estila is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Estila has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Estila requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Estila has been in this business for four years. In the future, Estila would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant plantains, yucca and malanga.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
A $800 loan is offered to Filomena to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She will use the loan to buy coconuts to sell. She is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 53 years old and married with four children. Diosdada works very hard to provide for them.

Diosdada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, bread, coffee, sugar, cereals, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. to sell. Diosdada has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, bread, coffee, sugar, cereals, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. 

Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like snack foods, bread, coffee, sugar, cereals, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony is 56 years old, a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Sony has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Sony has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Mr. Zorigt, 49 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been running a small kindergarten since 2005. His kindergarten is capable of caring for 20 children per day. 

So, he is requesting a loan of MNT 3,500,000 to rent a larger accommodation and to buy drawers, garments, and kitchen appliances for his kindergarten. Creating a more comfortable and spacious kindergarten will attract lots of clients and then improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to create a more comfortable kindergarten.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a widow with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucy is 62 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lucy has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Lucy requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

Lucy has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 65 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general así como pollo verduras, además cuenta con 1,5 ha de cacao, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes en general para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 65 years old. She lives in her own home made from local materials, in Pomahuaca district, located in Jaén province, which is part of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. It is a community with a hot climate, and the people who live there engage in agriculture, run businesses, and raise livestock.

She sells groceries in general, as well as chicken and vegetables. She also grows cacao on 1.5 hectares. She is an enterprising woman, and has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of groceries in general for stocking her business and thereby generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for stocking her business.

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es: Otoniel: Es un hombre trabajador, tiene 38 años de edad, casado con 1 hijo, de un año de edad. Tiene una finca de 300 manzanas en el empalme de Columbus, que se localiza a 4 horas del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, a 90 de tierra, engorda novillos y ganado. Utiliza 100 manzanas de tierras para pastos, el que es utilizado como alimento para el ganado. Solicita  su primer financiamiento para comprar ganado, engordarlos y venderlos a precios accesibles. Su sueño es incrementar el hato de ganado para tener mayores ingresos a través de la producción de carne y leche.
texts.en: Otoniel is hardworking. He is 38 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. He has a 500-acre farm in the community of Empalme de Columbus, which is four hours from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. He uses 150 acres to raise young bulls and cattle. He uses about 175 acres for hay, which is used as food for the cattle. This is his first loan, which he is requesting to buy cattle to then raise and sell at affordable prices. His dream is to increase the size of his herd of cattle to improve his income by selling both beef and milk.

loans.use: to buy cattle to then raise and sell.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en:
Imaculada is taking out a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a second-hand clothing store that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, jackets, kids' clothes, and other clothes. 

She opened her second-hand store a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Imaculada is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers, shorts, jackets, kids' clothes, etc. for resale.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es: Segundina de 55 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5  hijos de edades de 22,27, 29, 30 y 33 años, que  aun uno de sus hijos depende de ella. Lleva más 2 años como cliente de Edaprospo, se dedica a la venta de  frutas y a la venta de productos de belleza. Comenzó por medio de la motivación de su familia. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado salir  adelante, proporcionándole una mejor calidad de vida a su  familia. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta. Su plan para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y poner una tienda de ropas. Ella usara el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Segundina pertenece a la alcancía comunal “María Auxiliadora”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta. La Sra. Segundina es la persona que se encuentra en el medio con chompa morada.
texts.en:
Segundina, 55 years old, is single and has 5 children who are 22, 27, 29, 30, and 33 years old, one of whom is still dependent on her. She has been a client of Edaprospo for more than 2 years. She works selling fruit and selling beauty products.

She began through her family's motivation. With her effort and work she has succeeded in moving forward, providing a better quality of life for her family.  She covers food, education and clothing expenses. Her plan for the future is to make her business grow and put up a clothing store. 

She will use the loan for the purchase of merchandise. Segundina belongs to the group 'Maria Auxiliadora', which is made up of 6 people, and she carries the role of president. Segundina is the person in the middle of the photo with the purple sweater.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 12 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans le même village et les environs. Les membres sont solidaires et entretiennent de très bonnes relations. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche. 
Awa, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 64 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2garçons. Elle fait comme activité le commerce et l'embouche. Elle mène ces activités depuis longtemps, elle en a une bonne expérience.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter 5 moutons à 200000f, de l'aliment de bétail pour les besoins de l'engraissement des sujets. A l'approche de la Fête de Tabaski, elle compte vendre un mouton à 75000f.Concernant son commerce,elle achète 3 sacs de sucre, 50kg de café, du savon, du lait.
Les bénéfices me permettent d'entretenir mes enfants et renforcer mes épargnes.
texts.en:
This group of four women belong to the Banc Villageois that was set up on 12th December 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same village and the surroundings. The members are united and have a very good relationship. Their main activities are trading and raising animals.

Awa, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 64 years old. She is married and mother to four children, two of whom are boys. She has a small trading business and also raises animals. She has been carrying out these activities for a long time and thus has a lot of experience.

With the loan she is going to buy five sheep at 200,000 francs each and food for fattening up the animals. As the Tabaski festival approaches she is planning to sell a sheep for 75,000 francs. As far as her trading business is concerned, she is going to buy three sacks of sugar, 50 kilos of coffee, soap and milk. The profits enable her to take care of her children and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy sheep and various food products.

loans.name: Gundegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Gundegmaa, 35 years old, lives with her mother and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been selling clothes to local people since 2009. Her mother has retired from work and gets state pension. Her son goes to high school. Her husband has passed away. 

The apartment they live in has deteriorated over the years so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT for renovation. She will repair roofs, walls, and floors of her home, so that her old aged mother can live in a comfortable and warm place. Also, the renovated home will preserve energy and lose less heat.

loans.use: to renovate her home

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el Distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio mediante su mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 59 years old and lives in his own home in Cayalti district, located in Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque region on Peru's north coast. It is a community with a warm climate, and the people who live there engage in agriculture, run businesses, and raise livestock.

He provides transportation service with his mototaxi, transporting his passengers to the rural settlements neighboring his district. He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of parts for his vehicle, in order to continue offering service to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A loan of USD 800 has been offered to Maria to improve her business. Maria opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, Fanta, Coca-Cola and milk.

Maria is generating a good income from her sales. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of being in business. Maria is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, Fanta, Coca-Cola and milk

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is applying for a loan of USD 800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old. She is running a rental service in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy paper, ink and printer. 

Fatima is making a good income from her service, and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. Fatima is living in a town nearby the school, and her rental service is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to make copies.

loans.use: To buy paper, ink and printer

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 50, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a painter, and they have children. Rosita, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rosita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosita is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rosita hopes that her business will grow larger and dreams to have a happy family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Un Futuro Brillante Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Un Futuro Brillante”  se encuentra el municipio de Acatlán. En la comunidad la mayoría son católicos y cuando celebran la fiesta del pueblo todo se transforma, llegan mariachis, hay bailables, palo encebado, es un lugar tranquilo y un poco alejado de las otras comunidades.

Las integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son: Angela-Compra Y Venta De Platanos, Salome- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo, Susana-Venta De Comida, Delfino-Venta De Hot Dog y Hamburguesas y Maribel - perfumes y cosméticos.

Maribel se ha dedicado a la venta de perfumes, cosmérticos por catálogo desde hace ya 20 años, con las ganancias aporta para los gastos de la casa pues vive con sus padres a quien cuida pues ya son de edad avanzada. Ahora le corresponde a ella cuidarlos. De acuerdo con los miembros "un futuro brillante" es lo que han logrado al invertir el préstamo en cada uno de sus negocios los cuales les dan ganancias con las que pueden cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
The group “Un Futuro Brillante” (A Brilliant Future) is located in the municipality of Acatlan. In this community, the majority are Catholics and when they celebrate the town’s party everything is transformed: the mariachis arrive, there are dances, there is a greased pole; it is a calm place and a little bit far from other communities. 

The members of the group and their activities are: Angela  (purchase and sale of bananas), Salome (sales of shoes by catalogue), Susana (food sales), Delfino (sales of hot dogs and hamburgers), and Maribel (perfumes and cosmetics). 

It has been 20 years since Maribel has made a living from the sale of perfumes and cosmetics by catalogue. With the earnings, she makes a contribution to the home expenses given that she lives with her parents, whom she takes care off because they are of an advanced age. It is now up to her to take care of them. According to the members, "a brilliant future" is what they have achieved by investing the loan in each of their businesses, which give them a profit with which they can cover their expenses.

loans.use: to purchase PERFUMES, CREAMS, DEODORANT, EYELINER, BLUSH

location.town: Palma Cuata, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Cerro Mojarra Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca hay una comunidad que es en su mayor parte una laguna, es por eso que casi toda la población se dedica a la pesca y venta de mojarra: algunos salen a pescar en lancha de motor, otros tienen que remar, pero todos viven en armonía.

La laguna es el atractivo visual de la localidad, se ha desbordado ya tres veces, los habitantes han tomado las medidas de seguridad necesarias y gracias a dios no ha pasado a mayor problema. El grupo “Cerro Mojarra” está integrado por 7 personas dedicándose cada una a una actividad cada uno:

Maria Del Refugio-Venta De Mojarra, Maria de Jesús -Venta De Mojarra, Ofelia-Herreria, Laura- Pesca De Mojarra, Agustin-Venta De Mojarra, Juana- Venta De Antojitos y agustina - Elaboración y venta de pan.

Doña Agustina se ha dedicado desde hace ya 30 años a la elaboración y venta de pan, al principio era poco el pan que elaboraban lo cual cambió con el pasar de los años. Ella y su esposo agradecen a Kiva y a VisionFund por la gran oportunidad de obtener un préstamo puesto con él podrán comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, levadura, charolas y canastos para continuar con sus actividad e ir creciendo. Con las ganancias, han solventado los gastos de la familia, remodelación y adecuación del negocio al igual que la compra de insumos para la preparación del pan.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community that is mostly a lake, which is why almost all of the population works fishing and selling mojarra [a type of fish]. Some fish with a motorboat, and others in a rowboat, but all live in harmony.

The lake is the main visual attraction of the community. Although it has flooded three times, residents have taken the necessary security measures, and thanks to God, there have been no major problems.

The group "Cerro Mojarra" is made up of seven members who each have their own businesses: Maria Del Refugio, Maria de Jesús and Agustin sell mojarra; Ofelia is a metalsmith; Laura fishes mojarra; Juana sells snacks ["antojitos"]; and Agustina bakes and sells bread.

Agustina has baked and sold bread for 30 years. At first she made only a little bit of bread, but this has changed over the course of the years. She and her husband are grateful to Kiva and VisionFund Mexico for this great opportunity to request a loan, which Agustina will use to buy flour, sugar, butter, yeast, trays and baskets to continue growing her business.

She plans to use the profits to pay for some household expenses, as well as to remodel and renovate her business. She will also use some of the profits to buy ingredients for bread.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, yeast, trays and baskets for her bread-making business.

loans.name: Gabriel Estuardo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días los socios del Grupo de Crédito El Almendro. Este grupo está formado en su mayoría por gente humilde y trabajadora que luchan por sacar adelante a su familia. 
En este lugar vive don Gabriel, tiene 61 años de edad, está separado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos  mayores de edad y que aún viven en su casa.
El señor Gabriel tiene un pequeño deposito de colas en su casa, allí  vende colas, aguas, jugos y varios productos más,  el también tiene un carro en el cual realiza transporte de personal y entrega sus productos a domicilio, cuando el realiza el transporte de personal el negocio se lo atiende uno de sus hijos que vive en su casa. Lleva más de 10 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar colas, aguas, jugos y varios productos más para surtir su depósito. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es tener un negocio más grande y surtido.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo the members of the Credit Group "El Almendro" meet every fifteen days. This group is made up mostly of humble and hardworking people who fight to help their family get ahead. 

In this place lives Don Gabriel. He is 61 years old, is separated, and from this relationship has two grown up children, who still live in his house. Señor Gabriel has a small store of soft drinks in his house, and there he sells soft drinks, waters, juices and other various products. He also has a car which he uses to work in personal transport, and to deliver his products to his home. When he is working transporting people, one of his children who lives in his house attends to the business. He has been working in this area for more than 10 years, with which he has helped his children to get ahead. 

This loan will be used to buy soft drinks, waters, juices and other various products to stock his store. He has been with the Credit Group since its start, and he likes it because the loans are a big help. His dream is to have a larger and better stocked business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, juices, etc.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima felt grateful when she signed up membership with PMPC. Her needed capital was answered when she joined PMPC. PMPC to Zosimo came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed herself of a loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed funds for land and seed bed preparation.  She perseveres and always believes in reaching her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seed bed and land preparation

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 28 years old and single with two children. 
She has a small garden where she grows cabbage and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. Vanessa needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, new gum boots and new overalls. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Vanessa will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, new gum boots and new overalls

loans.name: Taupouga

texts.en:
Taupouga is a 60-year-old woman, who is unmarried and has five children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has four years of experience with this business.

Taupouga has requested a loan to buy new a sewing machine, material, thread, needles, buttons, and a new pair of scissors. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2010, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new a sewing machine, and other tools and supplies for sewing

loans.name: González Comercio Group

texts.es:
La Coraza es una localidad donde World Vision México también tiene influencia. Todos sus habitantes trabajan en el campo en la siembra y corte de caña al igual que de maíz, frijol, algunas personas también se dedican a la cría de pollos, borregos, pavos para venderlos y de esta manera obtener ingresos  y solventar los gastos de su familia.

El nombre del grupo “González Comercio” porque todos tienen una actividad económica productiva.

Los integrantes del grupo solo son tres; Adriana que se dedica a la crianza y venta de puerco; Lucila, a la venta de antojitos  y doña Socorro, a la venta de abarrotes en general. socorro comenta que el vender en casa alimentos de la canasta básica es la manera en que puede apoyar a sus vecinos para que de esta manera no tengan que transportarse hasta otros lugares para realizar sus compras. Precisamente esta razón fue lo que la empujó a poner su tienda en casa. Además, con las ganancias tiene la oportunidad de apoyara a su marido con los gastos familiares.

"Agradezco a Dios por darnos la sabiduría y fortaleza para continuar en el grupo y que se nos sigan otorgando préstamos para crecer con nuestros negocios". Dijo muy agradecida doña Socorro.
texts.en:
La Coraza is a town where World Vision Mexico also has influence. All of its inhabitants work in the field planting and cutting cane, also corn and beans. Some people also make a living raising chickens, sheep, and turkeys to sell and that way obtain a profit and cover the family expenses. 

The name of the group “González Comercio” is because all have a productive economic activity. 

There are only three members of the group: Adriana, who makes a living raising and selling pork; Lucila, selling snacks; and Mrs. Socorro, selling general groceries. 

Socorro says that selling basic staple goods is the way she can support her neighbors so that they do not have to go to other places to make their shopping. It is precisely this reason that pushed her to open her store at home. Furthermore, with the earnings she has the opportunity to support her husband with the family expenses. 

Mrs. Socorro said very thankfully that, “I thank God for giving us the wisdom and strength to continue in the group and that we continue to get loans to grow our businesses”

loans.use: to purchase oil, coffee, tuna, rice, sugar, canned chilli, soup, cookies etc.

location.town: La Coraza, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Clara Eugenia

texts.es: Clara Eugenia, tiene la edad  de 45 años, está soltera,  vive con sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera de buena calidad y que tenga características adecuadas para poder realizar diferentes artículos y figuras de artesania, además de productos que le den un mejor acabado a los trabajos y que le den un valor agregado, también algunas herramientas que le faciliten el trabajo final de los productos y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso personal o decorativa de locales y viviendas, y todos de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Clara Eugenia, 45, is single and lives with her children, who constitute her highest priority. She will invest the loan money in the purchase of good quality wood with the right characteristics to produce different articles and handicrafts and in products to give her crafts a better finishing touch to elevate their worth. She will also buy tools to facilitate her work. In this way she will be able to offer her customers a larger amount of products for personal or decorative use in stores and homes, all of them of good quality.
With these purchases, she hopes to improve her income so she can invest more in her business and meet some of her goals, which will improve the quality of life for her and her family.
This is Clara's first loan through the partner institution, FUDECOSUR. She has received no previous loans from national banks, but the partner institution has offered her more ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to manufacture handicrafts

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 54-year-old married woman with eight children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Corazon has a fishing business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Corazon has been in this business for two years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en: Jeny is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, shampoo, coffee, oils and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of $200.  She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan, because loans are offered for poor people, to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store, such as cigarettes, sugar, milk, noodles, shampoo and slippers

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is taking a loan of (USD) $800 to improve her business that helps her generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy goats to sell. She opened her business a year ago with her own working capital of (USD) $200. She is a hard-working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam es divorciada, tiene tres hijos y vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un anticretico Miriam se gana la vida elaborando productos de confiteria y necesita un credito para comprar insumos como azucar, harina, mantequilla, sal, etc. Miriam recibe ayuda de su ex marido, pero solo para gastos de los hijos por eso es que Miriam necesita su colaboracion para revitalizar su negocio
texts.en: Miriam is divorced; she has three children and lives with her parents in La Paz, in a brick and cement house where she paid an initial fixed sum to rent it. Miriam makes a living making confectionary products and needs a loan to purchases inputs such as sugar, flour, butter, salt, etc. Miriam receives help from her ex-husband, but only for the expenses of her children, that is why Miriam needs your help to revitalize her business.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like sugar, flour, butter, salt, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn's request for loan was granted and she used it in her direct selling business. She had the opportunity to make more income with the wider variety of products that she purchased from her loan. She also used the loan for the education of her children and for their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their family. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn dreams that her business will flourish even more and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Meki

texts.en: Meki is a 36-year-old single woman with five children. She makes and sells popcorn in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Meki needs a loan to buy popping corn, cooking oil, plastic bags, salt, butter, a deep pot, a strainer and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Meki has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy popping corn, cooking oil, plastic bags, salt, butter, a deep pot, a strainer and a new oven

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena joined PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

To continue her good sales volume, Magdalena has requested a loan to buy more items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee and milk. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee and milk for resale.

loans.name: Latea

texts.en:
Latea is 55 years old and married, and she has 10 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for five years.

Latea needs a loan to buy a display fridge, snacks, frozen goods, canned items, a chest freezer, and a new hanging scale. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2009, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a display fridge, a chest freezer, a new hanging scale, and some inventory

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 77 years old, and a widowed mother of nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years.

Filomena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, like blouses, shorts, t-shirts and jeans.

In the future, Filomena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell, like blouses, shorts, t-shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn, age 35, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, candies, cooking oil, and noodles.

She and her husband have three children, one of whom is currently in school. Rubelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rubelyn has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more groceries to offer for sale.

In the future, Rubelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 53 years old and married. Leonida works very hard to provide for her family.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leonida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Maricel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Maricel has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, who operates a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family, is requesting a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy grilled skewers of buffalo meat and beef as well as clothing to sell.

A hardworking woman, Maria opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy grilled skewers of buffalo meat and beef as well as clothing to retail.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old and married. She has nine children, one of them still in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, candies, noodles, and detergent soap.

Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, and cereals.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario sells charcoal to earn an income. Her enterprise brings in a small income of PhP 6,000 per month. Though her earnings are meager, she smiles when she recounts how much her family's living conditions have improved since she started her business. 
 
She finds the business of buying and selling charcoal to be easy to accomplish, because it simply involves weighing and repacking each purchase of charcoal for her buyers. She now plans to expand this retail business. She has therefore applied for a loan through PMPC for the capital with which to purchase an inventory of charcoal to offer for sale. 

She tells us that her business has helped her to ensure the survival of her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel, 31, is a married woman and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Maridel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Maridel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana runs a general store business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She and her husband work hard to support the family.

Susana has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to to purchase more groceries to offer for sale in her store.

Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Juvelina

texts.en: A (USD) $800 loan is offered to Juvelina to improve her retail kiosk business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of (USD) $100. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like fish, bread, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and other groceries. She is generating a good income from selling things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy fish, bread, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 33 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Grace has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Grace has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a second-hand [clothing store] that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as shirts, trousers, shorts, short sleeves, and sport pants. She opened her second-hand a year ago, with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock to keep in her store, such as shirts, trousers, and shorts

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 12 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans le même village et les environs. Les membres sont solidaires et entretiennent de très bonnes relations. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Sokhna, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2garçons.
Elle fait comme activité le commerce. Elle achète de l'huile au marché hebdomadaire pour le revendre. Elle mène cette activité depuis longtemps, elle en a une bonne expérience.Comme activité parallèle elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Ainsi avec le prêt reçu, elle achète 20l d'huile à 15500f pour revendre le litre à 900f. Elle achète aussi 4 moutons à 25000f ou 30000f l'unité pour les élever au bout d'un certain moment elle les revend à 70000f chacun.
Avec les bénéfices, elle participe au bien être de sa famille en appuyant son mari dans la dépense quotidienne les frais de scolarité des enfants, leurs soins médicaux. Elle renforce aussi son épargne dans la banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of four women belongs to the banc villageois created on December 12, 2009. The group members live in the same village and nearby. They show a spirit of solidarity and maintain friendly relations. Their main business activity is retail and raising livestock.
Sokhna, the one standing on the right raising her hand in the photo, is 38 years old. She is married and has four children, two of them boys.

She works as a vendor. She buys oil at the weekly market and then resells i. She has been in this business for some time and is very experienced. As an additional business, she raises sheep. With her loan, she will buy 20 liters [5 gallns] of oil at 15,000 West African francs, to resale at 900 francs per liter.
She will also buy four sheep at 25,000-30,000 francs each to fatten them and resale in due time at 70,000 each.
Thanks to her revenues, she helps ensure her family’s well-being by helping her husband with everyday expenses as well as their children’s school fees and healthcare expenses. She is also growing her savings at the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy oil and sheep.

loans.name: Ma. Luna

texts.en:
Margaret Luna, age 30 and unmarried, runs a general store business to earn her living. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and grocery goods. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy grocery goods and general household items to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, Margaret Luna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods and general household items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, salt, sugar, cookies, toilet paper.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia runs an Internet café to earn an income. She has been in this business for 10 years, sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She earns an additional income from a motorcycle rental business. Alicia is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 50,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase an additional computer for her Internet café as well as spare parts for her business.

She dreams of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer for her Internet café as well as spare parts for her business

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reyna de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, esta casada desde hace 20 años. Ha procreado 7 hijos de las edades de 35, 30, 28, 25, 23, 19 y 15 años de edad;  su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maiz y frijoles, en casa de ella solo viven ella, su esposo y tres hijos los unicos que estan solteros los memas todos tienen sus hogares aparte.

Ella se dedica a los ofiocs domesticos, pero ayuda a su esposo en la milpa, cultivan maiz y frijoles ella ya tiene mucho tiempo dedicandoce a esto, este trabajo lo aprendio en la finca ya que ella siempre sea dedicado a trabajar en la finca por las mañanas de ayudante de caporal de su esposo y por las tardes en los oficios domesticos, trabaja con su esposo de 5.30am a 2pm.

Con el prestamo es para comprar 3 sacos de abono, dos litros de gramoson y un litro de paracuac todo esto para darle mantenimiento a la milpa que ya esta creciendo . Con este prestamo ella se vera beneficiada porque sabe que si hace una buena siembra tendra buenos frutos.

Los sueños que tiene son poder crecer cada año con la siembra de maiz y con eso tener mejores ingresos, con lo que tendrá una fuente de ingreso segura, para echar mano para sus gastos. Las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y invertirlo en arreglos de la casa, ya que esta en mal estado.
texts.en:
Reyna is 55 years old, studied until the fourth grade, and has been married for 20 years. She has 7 children, and their ages are 35, 30, 28, 25, 23, 19 and 15. Her husband works in agriculture planting corn and beans. She and her husband live at home with their three sons who are still single, and the others have their own homes.

She works in the home, but helps her husband in the fields. They grow corn and beans, and she has been doing this for a long time. She learned to do this work on the property; in the morning she helps her husband’s foreman from 5:30 am to 2pm, and in the afternoon she tends to the house.

With the loan, she can buy three sacks of fertilizer, two liters of graxomone, and one liter of paracuat to maintain the growing field. She will benefit from this loan, as she knows that good plantings make good fruit.

Her dreams are to grow the corn planting business and, with this, to have better earnings. She will have a secure source of income that will help out with costs. The earnings will be invested in bill payment and in updates to the house, as it is currently in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of fertilizer, two liters of graxomone, and a liter of paraquat to maintain the field.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en:
Itagia, age 42, grows cabbages and cucumbers in a small vegetable garden. She earns an income by selling her produce in her community or at the market. She has been engaged in this business for one year. 

She is the single mother of four children, and she works very hard to support her family.

Itagia became a member of SPBD this year with the goal of improving her business. She requested a loan in order to buy fertilizer, seeds, a tiller, a spade, a wheelbarrow, insect poison, and gloves.
 
Itagia will use the increased profits from her sales to cover her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, a tiller, a spade, a wheelbarrow, insect poison, and gloves

loans.name: Cisne (Flat) Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca, hay una comunidad productora de caña, donde se celebra la fiesta de San Eulogio el dia 11 de marzo, realizando un pequeño recorrido, rodeo, baile y feria. En este lugar varias personas se unieron para conformar un grupo de préstamo llamado "Cisne". Los integrantes se dedican a las siguientes actividades: 

Erika-Venta De Calzado
Elizabeth-Venta De Abarrotes
Maximina-Servicio De Carga
Keren-Venta De Ropa
Josué-Taller de Soldadura

Josue se dedica desde hace  2 años al servicio de taller de soldadura en casa de sus padres donde vive también con su esposa e hijos. La herrería la aprendió de su padre quien le dijo que el mejor regalo que le podía dar era el trabajo. Con las ganancias apoya a sus padres con el gasto de la casa, paga los servicios de luz y agua que  utiliza en el taller.

El préstamo otorgado lo utilizará para la compra de materia como ángulos, marcos, soldadura, para continuar con la elaboración de puertas, ventanas, cortinas, protecciones y cualquier artículo que sus clientes le soliciten.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca there is a community that produces sugar cane, where they feast San Eulogio on the 11th of March by making a small tour, rodeo, dance and fair. Here, several people joined together to make the loan group “Cisne” (Swan). The members make a living from the following activities: 

Erika – selling footwear
Elizabeth – selling groceries
Maximina – Freight service
Keren – selling clothes
Josue – welding workshop 

It has been two years since Jose has made a living from a welding shop in his parents’ home, where he also lives with his wife and children. He learned the blacksmith skills from his father, who told him that the best gift he could give him was work. With the earnings he supports his parents with the home expenses, he pays the electricity and water bills that he uses in the workshop. 

The loan will be used to purchase stuff such as angles, frames, welding, to continue making doors, windows, curtain, protections, and any other item requested by his customers.

loans.use: angles, squares, and welding

loans.name: April Jane

texts.en:
April Jane, age 42, farms rice and corn to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for two years, She earns an additional income by operating a general store. 

She and her husband have three children.

April Jane requested a loan in the amount of PhP 4,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta operates a fishing and fish vending business to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years. She and her husband work hard to support their family. 
 
Anacleta requested a loan in the amount of PhP 21,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy essential materials and gears needed in her fishing business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy essential materials and gears needed in her fishing business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca operates a general store business to earn her living, sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF. She earns an additional income from farming rice. As the parent of five children, Francisca works hard to support her family.

With her previous loan successfully repaid, Francisca has requested PhP 20,000 through NWTF to further build her business. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, and coffee to sell in her store.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, and coffee to sell in her store

loans.name: Bella Monalisa

texts.en:
Bella Monalisa is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Bella Monalisa has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Bella Monalisa has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, and nylon threads for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, and nylon threads for her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 55 years old and married with eleven children, five of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.

Lilia has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Eutequia

texts.en:
Eutequia crafts shells to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 14 years. She and her husband work hard to support their family. 

Eutequia requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more materials for her business.

Her goal is to build enough savings to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shell-crafting materials for her crafts business

loans.name: Ricardo Samuel

texts.es: Ricardo de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 7 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ricardo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 31 years old, he lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. He grows corn for a living and for the past seven years he has been selling his product in various markets near where he lives. He is able to take care of some household expenses with the money he earns from the sales. 

Ricardo is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc., to be able to continue with sales and that way he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 55 years old, married and has children. As a way of generating income, she has engaged in tailoring business within her community in Cavite, Philippines for years now. She, together with her husband, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.
