She mainly offers lace, curtains, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Melinda wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Melinda hopes that her business will continue to operate and help her to provide their needs. 

In the future, she dreams of having a peaceful and sufficient living with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as beer, soft drinks, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, bath soap, and noodles. She has been in this business for two years.

Elvira has requested a 45,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jenelie works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns income from fishing. 

Jenelie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her general store. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to further build her business. Jenelie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Emma has requested a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 59 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming citrus in the Philippines. Bella is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers.

Bella has been farming citrus for twelve years and also earns additional income from buying and selling sweet potatoes.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loans.name: Suset

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Suset works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn. Suset is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Suset has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 60 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felicidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as cooking oil, detergent soap, soy sauce, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, etc. 

Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle buys and sells rice to earn her living, sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF. She also earns additional income from running a general store. As the married parent of five children, Annabelle works hard to support her family.

Annabelle requested PhP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase sacks of rice to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Jossielyn

texts.en:
Jossielyn is 27 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Jossielyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal for one year, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jossielyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jenna

texts.en:
Jenna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Jenna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her rice grains business.

Jenna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Gerarda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

In the future, Gerarda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marenin

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marenin works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn. 

Marenin is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marenin has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Conchita works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Conchita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional box of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with seven children; she is 30 years old and four of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juliet has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Juliet requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Jeffrey Pablo

texts.es:
Jeffrey es un joven de 18 años, quien sueña con su título universitario a diario. A su corta edad, ya sabe qué quiere en su futuro, luego que termine con su carrera de Ingeniería en Sistemas en la UNICIF. Desde hace dos años, emprendió en este camino tecnológico y lleno de conocimiento con el apoyo moral y económico de sus padres. 
La carrera de Jeffrey demanda estar a la vanguardia de la tecnología para poder poner en práctica lo aprendido desde el inicio, por ende, necesita de un préstamo para comprar una laptop y así poder desempeñarse mejor en su carrera universitaria. La visión de Jeffrey ya está más que planeada ya que entre sus metas está terminar su carrera, tomar una especialización y poner en marchar sus conocimientos en un trabajo estable en cuanto pueda.
texts.en:
Jeffrey is an 18 year-old whose daily dream is to get his college degree. At his young age, he already knows what he wants to do with his future after he obtains his degree in Systems Engineering at UNICIF. He began his technological studies two years ago with the moral and economic support from his parents.

Jeffrey’s degree path requires that he stay at the forefront of technology to be able to be able to execute what he has learned. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy a laptop, which will enable him to perform better in college. Jeffrey has a clearly planned vision for the future; his goals include finishing his degree, choosing a specialization, and begin putting all that he has learned to work with a steady job.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs, compost, insecticides, herbicides, fungicides, and seeds.

loans.name: Korina

texts.en:
Korina, age 51 and widowed with five children, makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living, She has been engaged in this business for four years. 

Korina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan in order to buy fabric paint, brushes, stencils, a cutter, material, rollers, and new wooden carved designs. 

She plans to use her increased profits to cover her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brushes, stencils, a cutter, material, rollers, and new wooden carved designs

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 17 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ana  solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old, she lives with her partner and their two children. She has had a beauty salon business in her home for 17 years. She works from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm and she has a lot of customers, because she is a good worker. They are able to pay for the household expenses using her earnings along with help from her partner.

Ana is requesting a loan to be able to buy products for her beauty salon such as: creams, shampoos, hair clips, and scissors, among other items that she needs. This way she will be able to make a better profit, which will help them be more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos, hair clips, and scissors, among other items.

loans.name: East Africa Fruit

texts.en:
East Africa Fruit works with dozens of small-scale farmers in Tanzania, helping them increase their crop yields, decrease their post-harvest losses, and from these efforts increase their annual income by aggregating, processing, and distributing their fruits and vegetables.

In the three years since East Africa Fruit was founded, it has grown its farmers' incomes from an average of US$500/yr to US$2,900, which is nearly five times the average income in Tanzania.

East Africa Fruit is founded and run by Elia (pictured), a young entrepreneur who has bootstrapped this business from working with one farm to over 50 farmers today.  Elia attended Fledge, the conscious company accelerator, in Seattle this past Spring to help further speed up the growth of his company.

This loan is part of that effort.  None of EA Fruit's farmers today have an irrigation system.  They rely solely on the rain falling from the sky to water their crops.  This loan will pay for an irrigation system, lowering the risk of a dry growing season, while increasing the quality of the harvest.

loans.use: to install an irrigation sytem

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita, age 60, farms rice and corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She also earns an additional income by operating a general store.

She and her husband have seven children.

Bernadita requested PhP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: Rosana de 43 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Rosana actualmente pertenece al grupo “Señor De Los Milagros”  constituida por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y activas.  Con los deseos de superarse Rosana  inicia su negocio de manualidades. Rosana se siente feliz pues con su esfuerzo ha llegado a cumplir algunos de sus sueños darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de hilos, botones y tijera. El grupo “Señor De Los Milagros” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Rosana se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chompa marrón.
texts.en:
Rosana, 43, is separated and has one dependent child.  Currently she belongs to Señor de los Milagros Group, made up of six enterprising and active women.

Rosana wanted to improve herself so she started her crafts business.  She's happy because with her effort she has managed to achieve one of her dreams: to give her son a better quality of life.  She'll spend her latest loan on thread, buttons, and scissors.

Señor de los Milagros Group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.

Rosana's in the back; she's the second person from the right and is wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons, and scissors

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: Bertha Adilia esta solicita el crédito para invertirlo siempre en su negocio de venta de ropa, con el dinero comprará calzado y ropa interior para hombre, mujeres y niños. Con el crédito anteriormente otorgado pudo invertir en su negocio, en la compra de productos para ofertar a sus clientes y de esta manera ir haciendo más grande y completa la variedad que ofrece. Dos hijos de Bertha están estudiando, y uno de ellos ya trabaja. Su esposo le sigue apoyando en los gastos del hogar, desempeñándose como albañil.
texts.en: Bertha Adilia is requesting a loan to invest in her business selling clothing.  With this loan, she will buy shoes and underwear for men, women, and children.  With her last loan, she was able to invest in her business.  She bought products to sell to her customers, and in this way she increased the variety of items that she offered for sale. Two of Bertha's children are in school, and one of them is already working.  Her husband continues to support the household expenses with his work in construction.

loans.use: to buy shoes and underwear

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Tras haber tomado su cafecito caliente, su principal energizante natural de Don José Luis está listo para salir a vender en su bicicleta las bolsas de plástico que comercializa en las diferentes pulperías y el mercado popular de su comunidad. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos. Hace ochos años se dedica a la venta de bolsas, inició con un pequeño capital, el cual poco a poco ha ido creciendo y con la ayuda de su esposa ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 
José solicita el préstamo para incrementar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar bolsas de todo tipo y tamaños, desde de las una libra hasta las gabachas grandes. El deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que gracias a este logrará crecer en el negocio, alcanzando un mejor nivel de ventas y mejores ingresos. Uno de sus planes futuros es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, de manera que su familia pueda desarrollarse con éxito en la sociedad
texts.en:
After drinking his hot coffee, José Luis’ main natural energizing, he is ready to go out and sell on his bicycle the plastic bags that he commercializes in the different small grocery stores and the market of his community. 

He is 38 years old, married and has three children. He has sold plastic bags for the last eight years. He started this activity with a small capital, which has been increasing little by little. With his wife’s help, he has been able to support his family. 

José is requesting this loan to increase his business’ production. He needs to buy bags of all kinds and sizes, small and large. He has faith in this loan, since it will help him to make his business grow by having more sales and increasing his income. 

One of his plans for the future is to improve his home conditions, so his family can have a successful development in society.

loans.use: to buy bags of all kinds and sizes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a 26-year-old divorced mother of three, has a small garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years, and uses the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

Having joined SPBD this year, Maria is requesting a loan to buy insect poison, sprayers, a tiller, spade, new wheelbarrow and gloves.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, sprayers, a tiller, spade,  new wheelbarrow and gloves

loans.name: Francisco Gabriel

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 53 años, comenta que hace 25 años que se dedica a la peluquería, es un hombre muy sacrificado que esta luchando para poder ayudar a su familia. comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, lo que le ayudo a dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en la compra de insumos para su salón de belleza, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues y demás, para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Francisco is 53 years old and says that he has been in the hair salon business for the past 25 years.   He sacrifices a lot and is working hard to be able to help his family.  He says that his previous loan was used to buy inputs for his salon, which helped him provide better service to his customers.  He is asking for this loan so that he can invest again in his purchase of products for his beauty salon, such as dyes, shampoo, rinses and more, so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos, rinses and more.

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is 59 years old and has eight children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Nancy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Nancy has been farming vegetables for six years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of banana business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Daisy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Sophay

texts.en:
Sophay (shown in the photo) lives across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has six children she takes care of at home.

Sophay's husband is a construction worker and is also hired by villagers to cut trees. She is requesting this loan to pay for a sawing machine he bought on credit.

loans.use: To pay for a sawing machine for her husband.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través de la cual quieren ayudar a sus familias e ir superando su pobreza.
Una de ellas es la señora  Laura, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que debe seguir esforzándose por mejorar. Ella es ama de casa, pero para poder crecer ha sido capacitada para realizar venta de cosméticos en su barrio para generar más ingresos y comenta que este préstamo lo solicito para poder comprar cosméticos variados para la venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo. Las chicas menores en la foto son las hijas de los prestatarios.
texts.en:
Koeju is a new group in its first loan cycle. Every member is committed to eliminating poverty; they want to help their families and conquer their poverty.

One of the members is named Laura, who in her survey rated a level one on the poverty scale, that is to say she should keep making efforts to improve. She is a housewife, but in order to be able to grow she has been trained to sell cosmetics in her neighborhood in order to generate more income. She says that this loan is to be able to buy various cosmetics to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity that they all are receiving. The younger girls in the photo are the daughters of the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her business, like shells and wire.

Lorna has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business, like shells and wire.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 51 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Lourdes has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell including coffee, milk, juice, detergent soap, eggs, and shampoo.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell including coffee, milk, juice, detergent soap, eggs, and shampoo.

loans.name: Anida

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Anida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening.  Anida is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Anida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: by buying cream, roll-on, grease, spray etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water and beer to expand his business.

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo d maíz y frijol, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Juan está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y también mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra en la fotografía para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 35 years old, lives in his own house with his family unit. He works growing corn and beans, and sells them to surrounding areas. With the profits from these sales, he manages to cover some household expenses. 

Juan is requesting a loan from  INTEGRAL to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., and also to improve the soil (which is the one shown in the photograph) to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc. and also to improve the land

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta y elaboración de tortillas trabaja de lunes a domingo por la tarde y por la noche, tiene mucha clientela ya que sus tortillas son ricas y calientitas y también por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, para seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria lives in her own home with her husband and children. She has worked for a number of years now making and selling tortillas. She works Monday to Sunday in the afternoons and in the evenings. She has many customers because her tortillas are delicious and warm, but also because she is very friendly when she is waiting on her customers. Maria is requesting this loan to buy corn and lime so she can continue with her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий женат. У него есть сын и трехлетняя дочь. Он имеет свой бизнес.

Виталий занимается реализацией напитков, овощей и фруктов. Торговые точки расположены на центральном рынке города.  Опыт работы у Виталия 3 года. Он открытый, предприимчивый и коммуникабельный. Были спады торговли, но Виталий нашел новые пути и возможности. Он хочет развивать бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
Виталий  просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме  15 000 гривен на закупку оборудования и товара для реализации.
texts.en: Vitaliy is married and has a son and a three-year-old daughter. He has his own business selling beverages, fruits and vegetables, and has shops in the central market. He has three years of experience and is an open, adventurous and sociable person. He experienced a decline in sales, but found new paths and opportunities. He wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. Vitaliy has requested a loan of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase equipment and goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for his business and increase sales turnover

loans.name: Bibisoro

texts.ru: Бибисоро молодая и энергичная женщина. Она родилась в 1988 году. Бибисоро замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети не совершеннолетние. Бибисоро уже более 8 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она шьет как национальные одежды, так и мужские одежды. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Бибисоро хочет отремонтировать свою мастерскую и другие комнаты своего дома, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Bibisoro is a young and energetic woman. She was born in 1988. Bibisoro is married and has three children. Her children are minors. For eight years already, Bibisoro has been offering sewing services. She sews both national dresses as well as men's clothing. She offers her services from home.

Bibisoro wants to renovate her workshop and other rooms in her home, since her house in in poor condition. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and the like.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and the like for home repairs

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leny works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Leny is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.ru:
Мукаддас любящая и любимая жена, и мама троих детей. Ей 46 лет. Мукаддас с семьей живет на районе Спитамен вблизи северного городка Худжанд. Мукаддас приветливая, отзывчивая и очень ответственна женщина. Она занимается продажей продуктов питания и моющих средств. Мукаддас сильно держится за свою работу. Ведь для нее и ее семьи данный бизнес приносит значительный доход. Мукаддас стремиться, чтобы ее дети не в чем не знали нужды, имели образование и светлое будущее. 
  Причина, по которой Мукаддас обратилась за кредитом, является нехватка средств, чтобы привести новый товар с большим ассортиментом продукции. Она надеется, что с Вашей помощью она увеличит товарооборот и увеличить доходность.
texts.en:
Muqaddas is a loving and beloved wife and a mother of three children. She is 46 years old. Muqaddas lives with her family in the Spitamen region close to the northern city of Khujand. Muqaddas is a friendly, responsive and very responsible woman. She sells food products and detergents. Muqaddas strongly holds to her work. At the end of the day, this business brings her and her family a significant income. Muqaddas strives for her children not to know need, to have an education, and a bright future.

The reason that Muqaddas requested a loan is that there are insufficient funds to add new inventory with a large assortment of products. She hopes that with helps she will improve her inventory and increase her profits.

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 61 years old and a widow, with six children.

Sherlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sherlita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming corn and rice.

Sherlita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) lives in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1985 and has three sons and two daughters. One of her children is married and lives in a separate home, one is a driver, and the others attend school. 

Touch is a cleaner for a company, while her husband is a construction worker. She plans to buy a motorbike for commuting because she does not have her own motorcycle and needs to ride to work with her neighbors very often.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна — предприниматель на рынке. Она занимается торговлей мужской и женской одеждой и обувью на местном базаре в своем родном городе — Белой Церкви. Работает в этой сфере уже 23 года. Опыт работы — колоссальный. Данной группой товаров торгует 17 лет. Торговое место у Татьяны свое — металлический контейнер. 
Сумма в 10 000 гривен нужна Татьяне для того, чтобы закупить сезонную летнюю мужскую обувь на продажу, расширить ассортимент и количество товара. Во время Майдана торги у Татьяны упали, и у мужа с работой тоже было не очень. Но Татьяна с оптимизмом смотрит вперед, так как сейчас торговля уже снова стала налаживаться.
texts.en:
Tatyana is a market entrepreneur. She sells men's and women's clothing and footwear at the local bazaar in her hometown, Beloi Tserkvi. She has been working in this sphere for 23 years. Her work experience is enormous. She has been selling this type of goods for 17 years. Tatyana has her own trade stall in a metal container.

Tatyana needs a sum of 10,000 hryvnia in order to buy seasonal summer men's shoes to sell, to increase the assortment and quality of goods. During Maidan trade fell for Tatyana, and her husband also did not have much work. But Tatyana looks forward with optimism as trade is now beginning to adjust.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal men's footwear

loans.name: Veronica Lizbeth

texts.es:
Verónica Lizbeth tiene 27 años de edad, reside en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, una zona rural del Distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de toma de fotografías, filmaciones y gigantografías, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro donde residir.
texts.en:
Veronica Lizbeth is 27 years old and lives in a rural community in Buenos Aires District. Her community has a hot climate, and its population works in agriculture, commerce and livestock-raising. It is located in Morropon Province, in Piura Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She has for several years had her own business taking photographs, filming events and producing giant-sized posters. Her business is located in her home. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy construction materials to make some repairs to improve the safety of her home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make some repairs to improve the safety of her home.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old and is married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming corn and rice.

Nancy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is single and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Luis Gilberto

texts.es:
Luis Gilberto tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Niepos, una zona rural del distrito de San Miguel, una comunidad de clima frío, paisajes verdes y de gente muy amable, que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de San Miguel que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Gilberto is 36 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and has two children. He lives with his family in Niepos district, a rural area in San Miguel district. This community has a cold climate, green landscapes and very friendly people who earn a living through farming, livestock farming and commerce. San Miguel district is located in San Miguel province, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Luis earns a living by raising and selling small animals. His business is located behind his home. He has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to use to buy feed to fatten animals. This will allow him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for fattening animals.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en casa de su madre en el Distrito de San Juan de Bigote, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y abarrotes, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 42 years old, single, and lives in her mother's house in the San Juan de Bigote district. This community is dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising. It is located in Moropon Province, pertaining to the Piura region on Peru's north coast.

Julia sells clothing and groceries. Her business is located in the back of her house. She has solicited a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 3,000 new sols to purchase a larger quantity of groceries to restock her business and, in this manner, to generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: buy groceries to restock her business.

location.town: San Juan de Bigote - Morropon - Piura

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and is married with eight children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Norma has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Luz is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, spices, fish, vegetables, rice, etc. for her food vending business.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, spices, fish, vegetables, and rice

loans.name: Lira Rose

texts.en:
Lira Rose is 36 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and earns an income from farming corn and rice.

Lira Rose aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are four members: Yan, Savat, Yoeun and Yon and they live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Yan, age 46, stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband who is a motor taxi driver.  Yan has one son and six daughters. Two of her children are married and live in separate homes, two are garment factory workers and the others attend school. One of her daughters, who is a garment factory worker, has a supplemental business buying and selling clothes. She wants to buy additional clothes for resale. Hence, Yan decided to apply for a loan to help her daughter.

Yoeun is on the left, next is Yon, then Savat and the last one is Yan.

loans.use: To help her daughter to buy additional clothes for resale.

loans.name: Katia Jhoanna

texts.es:
Katia Jhoana tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a La Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Katia Jhoana is 25 years old and lives with her husband and children in Zaña District, a community with a hot climate and whose population works in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock. It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling small animals. Her business is located in the back part of her property. She has requested this loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed to raise her animals. She hopes to improve her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to raise and sell small animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various products (corn, beans, preserves, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Gina

texts.en:
Maria Gina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Gina is 35 years old and her child is in school.

Maria Gina has a pet shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials and items like fish foods, fish, etc. to sell.

Maria Gina has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and items like fish food and fish to sell

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia tiene 31 años de edad quien en su niñez tuvo la oportunidad de cursar la primaria hasta su tercer grado ya que por problemas económicos no pudo culminar su primera etapa educativa. A muy temprana edad decidió tomar la decisión de formar un hogar y del mismo tiene 5 hijos la mayor tiene 13 años la cual cursa séptimo grado, su segundo hijo tiene 11 años cursa el quinto año de primaria, el tercer hijo tiene 9 años cursa el tercer año de primaria, el cuarto hijo tiene 5 años está en el kínder y su ultimo hijo tiene un año de edad. Muy agradecida con Dios primeramente por darle la fuerza y fortaleza que necesita para que sus hijos estudien y no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud, en segundo lugar por darle salud y vida para lograr cada uno de sus objetivos y metas ya que en compañía de su esposo luchan diariamente para dar a cada uno de sus hijos lo que está a su alcance y que ellos no dejen de estudiar. En compañía de su familia se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas (Papa) ya que sus padres le heredaron un terreno apto para sembrar teniendo dos años de dedicarse a dicha actividad el cual está ubicado a unos pocos metros de su casa de habitacion al cual tienen la oportunidad de trasladarse caminando o en bestia ya que no cuentan con otro medio de transporte. Sus metas y sueños es que sus cultivos sean productivos cada vez que se da la temporada pues como medio de ingreso económico para su familia y el bienestar de la misma dependen de dicho rubro. Es por esa razón que ella solicita pueda ser apoyada financiera mente para poder dar la asistencia necesaria y calificada a su plantación comprando los insumos que ayudaran a que dicho producto sea muy bien encaminado y rinda los frutos que ellos esperan como familia para poder salir adelante esperando ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionista en la plataforma.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 31 years old. As a child, she was able to go to school until the 3rd grade, but then could not continue to the end of primary school due to financial problems. At a young age, she decided to raise a family, and has five children. The oldest is 13 and in the 7th grade, the second is 11 and in the 5th grade, the third is 9 and in the 3rd grade, the fourth is 5 and in kindergarten, and the young is 1 year old. 

Anastacia is very grateful to God for giving her the strength she needs to ensure that her children go to school and don't find themselves in the same situation as she did in her youth, and also for giving her health and life so that she can meet her goals. She and her husband strive on a daily basis to give their children whatever they can so that they can continue studying. 

Anastacia earns a living by growing potatoes with the help of her family. Her parents gave her a piece of land which is suitable for growing, and she has been earning a living this way for two years. The land is located very close to her home, and she gets there by walking or riding a mule, as she doesn't have any other means of transport.

Her wish is for her crop to have a good yield every season, since this is a source of income for her family and their well-being depends upon it. Anastacia is requesting financial support so that she can provide her crop with the care it needs, by buying supplies which will ensure the yield that she and her family are hoping for in order to get ahead. She and her family hope to receive the support of the many investors who use this site.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her potato crop.

loans.name: Emie Angela Marie

texts.en:
Emie Angela Marie is 24 years old, with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Emie Angela Marie has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Pheany

texts.en:
Pheany is a 32-year-old widow. She lives with her mother in a village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

She is a garment factory worker. She wants to buy a cow to raise. Pheany will able to earn extra income from selling the cow for beef when the cow is fully grown or selling a calf if the cow gives birth to a baby. 

Pheany is pictured here after a break from work.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de una hija de 17 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Reina se gana la vida por medio de la venta de antojitos típicos y por medio de la venta de productos por catalogo. Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho para mantener la economía de su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar  sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un corredor en la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento,hierro, arena, polines y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en: Reina is 44 years old and a single mother of a 17-year-old daughter who is currently going to school. Reina earns her living by selling "antojitos" [traditional snacks] and by selling products from a catalog. She is a very hardworking woman who puts a lot of effort into meeting her household expenses. She has requested this loan from FUSAI to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand, purlins and corrugated metal roofing to build a hallway in her home. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, purlins and corrugated metal roofing to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Celsa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Celsa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Celsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with four children. She is 30 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maribel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es: Ana tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ana se gana la vida por medio de la elaboración de prendas de vestir desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda y cambiar las puertas. Con el monto comprará dos puertas, lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Ana is 63 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has earned her living for a number of years now making clothing. She uses her income from this business to pay household expenses. She has requested this loan from FUSAI to repair the roof of her house and to replace the doors. She would like to improve her family's living conditions. She will use the loan to buy two doors, corrugated metal roofing and wood. She would like to begin these repairs as soon as she can.

loans.use: to buy two doors, corrugated metal roofing and wood to repair the roof of her house and to replace the doors.

loans.name: Menime

texts.en:
Menime is a 46-year-old, married woman with six children. To earn a living, she makes and sells sandwiches, donuts, pies, and soft drinks in her community. She has nine years of experience with this business. 

Menime needs a loan to buy loaves of bread, butter, jam, canned tuna, mayonnaise, bags of flour, sugar, yeast, and soft drinks. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Menime has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2005.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread, butter, jam, canned tuna, mayonnaise, bags of flour, sugar, yeast, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
Sen was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members, Sen and Phors, and they live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.  

Sen, age 55, sells grocery items from home. She has been married since 1980 and has four married children - two sons and two daughters.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver. 

She wants to expand her grocery inventory by buying more grocery items for resale, so she requested a loan!

Sen is on the right and Phors is on the left.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 53 years old, married, and has only one child. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. 

Due to insufficient income, she is also engaged in buying and reselling various vegetables to earn additional income. She aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to buy family necessities and save for their future. 

Marilyn aims to acquire more vegetables to sell, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy more stock of various vegetables, grocery items, and rice to resell. 

She believes that she will obtain her loan request and be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of various vegetables, grocery items, and rice to resell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and reselling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Elsa is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase sacks of rice to sell for her business buying and reselling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now, she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a businesswoman, and her dream is for her house to be renovated. She hopes to live comfortably with a house that has good roofing, supported by her loan. She hopes to maintain her PMPC membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that Jane has been given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. That is what she is thankful for, because all the financing needs of her retailing business have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Rita Malolo

texts.en:
Rita is a 34-year-old woman who is married with four children. 

She has a small taxi business to earn a living. She has been working for seven years with this business. 

Rita needs a loan to buy new tires, shocks, new seat covers, a taxi sign indicator, and a new paint job. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, shocks, new seat covers, a taxi sign indicator, and a new paint job

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Nancy requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emily is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Nera

texts.en:
Nera is a married woman with four children. She is 38 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nera has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 14 years.

Nera requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more materials for her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon is 65 years old and a farmer in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. He operates a farming business in the rice field near his house. So far, he has been a farmer for 40 years, and the net profit that he can make is $5 per day.  

Chhon would like to improve his living conditions and make life more comfortable by having clean energy like solar to use in his household. Due to insufficient funds, he has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy a solar energy system for his home. 

This purchase will enable him to gain access to solar electricity which provides power to home devices such as lights, television, and radio. 

He thanks lenders for the financial support through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) which provides him with a much lower interest rate than for its general loan products.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a rice farmer, sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her past four loans from NWTF. She earns an additional income from selling vegetables. As the married parent of two children, Eden works hard to support her family.

Eden has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested a new loan through NWTF to further build her business. She will use her PhP 15,000 loan funds to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farm.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Relina

texts.en:
Relina buys and sells ginger to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earns an additional income from operating a general store. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. 

Relina requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy a stock of ginger to offer for sale.

She dreams of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ginger to offer for sale

loans.name: Los Portales Group

texts.es:
El nombre del municipio proviene de los vocablos chinantecos Ocotl-caña y de Tlan-junto a o entre,y significa junto o entre las cañas y es una comunidad cañera por tradición.

En esta localidad se formo un grupo llamado “Los Portales” el cual esta integrado por 4 mujeres muy trabajadoras cada una de ellas se dedica a una activad.

Ada-venta de cosméticos por catalogo, Teodora-venta de cosméticos por catálogo, Mirna-venta de calzado por catálogo y Jessica-calzado por catálogo y purificadora de agua.

Jessica es una persona muy trabajadora y carismática, tiene dos hijos, estudio la preparatoria, esta casada con Jorge Luis. Juntos han establecido una planta purificadora de agua, con las ganancias solventan los gastos del hogar, de transporte, mantenimiento de la herramienta de trabajo, sueldo de los empleados, de igual manera Jessica vende calzado por catalogo con sus amistadades y trabajadores.
Ella da las gracias a Kiva y a VisionFund México por la oportunidad de obtener un crédito que invertirá en garrafones, tapas, bandas y etiquetas, material que les hace falta en la purificadora pues el numero de clientes ha incrementado lo cual es muy favorable y satisfactorio.
texts.en:
The name of their municipality derives from the Chinanteca vocabulary 'Ocotl-cana' and 'de Tlan-junto a' or 'among', and it signifies 'together' or 'among the canes'. This is a sugar cane raising community by tradition. 

In this locality a group called “Los Portales” was formed; it's composed of 4 very hard-working women dedicated to these activities: Ada and Teodora sell cosmetics from catalogs; Mirna and Jessica sell shoes from a catalog, and Jessica also purifies water. 

Jessica is a very hard-working and charismatic person. She has 2 children, studied into preparatory school, and is married to Jorge Luis. Together they have established a water purification plant. With their earnings, they cover their household costs, transportation, maintenance of their work tools, and the salaries of their employees. At the same time, Jessica also sells shoes by catalog among her friends and fellow workers.

She is grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund Mexico for the opportunity to obtain this loan, which will be invested in 5-gallon jugs, tops, bands, and labels, supplies that they lack in the purifying plant. The number of their customers has increased, which is very favorable and satisfactory.

loans.use: buy 5-gallon plastic bottles, caps, bands, and labels.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon (pictured here) is 39-years-old and lives in a village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has seven children - two sons and five daughters. One of her children is married, two have full-time employment, and two attend school and others are still young. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Thon sells fish in her local market that her husband catches. She wants a replacement of a new boat motor for her husband, which would be better for fishing because the old one is breaking and does not work well.

loans.use: To assist with her husband’s fishing business by buying a new boat motor.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. 

Lourdes, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 10000 to buy more sacks of rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, three of whom are in school, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase rice grains to sell for her business of buying and selling rice grains.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47-years-old and has four children. Nilda is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Nilda is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nilda has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install drinking water service in her house and to buy corrugated metal roofing to repair her roof.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 61-years-old and married with seven children. Paterna works very hard to provide for them.

Paterna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, sanitary pads, juice, milk, coffee, detergent soap and other groceries to sell.

Paterna has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary pads, juice, milk, coffee, detergent soap and other groceries. 

Paterna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, sanitary pads, juice, milk, coffee, detergent soap and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Dy’S Group

texts.en:
Dy, age 50, is the group leader of these two borrowers who are requesting a loan from Maxima. Dy is pictured to the left of her fellow borrower Sarorn. Both borrowers live in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from the city of Phnom Penh. 

Dy buys and sells fabric to earn her living. She purchases netting, cotton, and silk at market in Phnom Penh, then transports these materials via taxi to offer for sale in other provinces. Each time she cycles through this process, she must stay in Phnom Penh for about one week. 

In order to to be able to purchase more at a time so that she can make each purchase last longer, Dy would like to increase the volume of of netting, cotton, and silk that she buys each time. This is why she decided to apply for a loan. 

Dy and her husband, who is a construction worker, have three sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is employed as a cleaner, two are garment factory workers, and another holds full-time employment.

loans.use: to buy netting, cotton, and silk to offer for sale

loans.name: Vicenta Blanca

texts.es: Vicenta tiene 50 años de edad y  desde hace 20 año se dedica a la venta de quesos y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Vicenta solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava dado que desea encementar el piso de la vivienda y además desea repellar las paredes de la misma. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 50 years old and has worked for 20 years selling cheese. This is how she earns her living and pays for her household expenses.
She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to put in a cement floor in her house and to plaster the walls.
She hopes to begin these repairs as soon as she can.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to put in a cement floor in her house and to plaster the walls.

loans.name: Danilo Ramiro

texts.es: Danilo tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 años y 4 años de edad. Danilo trabaja como operario en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena dado que desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Danilo is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children, aged 11 and 4.  Danilo works for a company near his town; this is how he earns a living and supports his household.  With the desire to improve his living conditions, he decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in cement and sand, as he wants to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of his house

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia works hard to support her family. Porferia is married and has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines.

Porferia requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Porferia has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Porferia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel has a live-in partner woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raquel is 43-years-old and has two children who are currently in school.

Raquel has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business.

Raquel has been in this business for three years. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her business of buying and selling coconut wine.

Roselia has been in this business for 30 years. Roselia earns more income from selling firewood.

Roselia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира вместе со своими детьми и мамой живет в южной части Таджикистана. Она разведенная. Назира занимается купле продажей продуктов питания в продуктовом магазине. Она продаёт все виды продуктов питания. Ее продуктовый магазин находится в центре района. Назира этим бизнесом занимается уже более 6 лет. Она с бизнесом справляется успешно и ее мать помогает ей введению бизнеса. Назира хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Nazira lives together with her children and her mother in the southern part of Tajikistan. She is divorced. Nazira works with selling grocery products in her grocery store. She sells all types of grocery products. Her store is in the center of the region. 

Nazira has worked in this business for more than six years. She manages the business successfully, and her mother helps her deal with it. Nazira would like to increase her working capital and this way increase her income. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase grocery products for increasing her working capital. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products and increase working capital

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en:
Fiapaipai, age 23 and unmarried, runs a small "sausage sizzle stand" in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this type of business. 

Fiapaipai has requested a loan in order to buy a new barbecue set as well as soy sauce, sausages, buns, onions, and foil. She plans to use the increased profits from this loan investment to cover her family's weekly expenses. Some of the profits will be saved toward the further expansion of her business. 

Fiapaipai has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a new barbecue set as well as soy sauce, sausages, buns, onions, and foil

loans.name: Lolakhon

texts.ru: Лолахон трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Лолахон всегда старается улучшить условию проживания для своих детей. Ее муж мастер по ремонту дома. Лолахон 6 месяцев назад начала свой новый бизнес купле продажей одежды на местном рынке. Ранее она занималась выращиванием и продажей сельхоз культур.  Она продолжает этот бизнес тоже. Лолахон выращивает в основном овощи как лук, морковь, капуста и т.п. Ее родня помогают ей введению бизнеса. Лолахон хочет расширить свой новый бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки одежды для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Lolakhon is a hardworking woman. She is married and is raising three children. Her children are not yet grown-ups. Lolakhon always tries to improve the living conditions for her children. Her husband is a master carpenter, he renovates houses. 

Six months ago Lolakhon started a new business of selling clothing at the local market. Earlier she worked with growing and selling field crops. She still continues this business too. Lolakhon mainly grows vegetables such as onions, carrots, cabbage and so on. Her relatives help her manage the business. 

Lolakhon would like to expand her new business. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to purchase clothing for increasing her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell, in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina runs a handicraft business to earn an income. She has been in this business for 20 years. She and her partner work hard to support their family. 

Sabina has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more raw materials like shells and wire for her crafts business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like shells and wire for her crafts business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs (fertilizers and pesticides) to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда добросовестная и порядочная женщина. Она родилась в 1963 году. Махсуда замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж преподаватель. Махсуда тоже имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает учительницей английского языка в средней школе. Махсуда имеет большого педагогического опыта и является одной из лучших учителей. Она начала свой бизнес переработкой и продажей сухофруктов 6 лет назад, так как ее зарплата маленькая. Махсуда каждый год покупает абрикосы, перерабатывает, сушит и продает на местном рынке как «курага». Она довольна своим бизнесом и справляется с бизнесом сама. Махсуда планирует купить абрикосы для переработки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки абрикосов. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahsuda is a conscientious and decent woman. She was born in 1963. Mahsuda is married and raising 5 children. Her husband is a teacher. Mahsuda also has a higher, pedagogical education. She works as an English language teacher at a secondary school. Mahsuda has a lot of teaching experience and is one of the best teachers. She started her business of processing and selling dried fruits 6 years ago because her teaching salary is low. Mahsuda buys apricots every year, processes, dries and sells dried apricots, known as "kuraga," at a local market. She is happy with her business and manages it by herself. Mahsuda plans to purchase apricots for processing. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase apricots. She awaits and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy apricots for processing

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 12 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans le même village et les environs. Les membres sont solidaires et entretiennent de très bonnes relations. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Ngore, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 garçons.
Elle fait de l'embouche bovine comme activité génératrice de revenus. Avec le prêt elle va acheter un bœuf à 150000f, des vaccins et de l'aliment de bétail  pour les besoins de l'engraissement du bétail.Elle espère revendre le bœuf à 180000f.
Avec les bénéfices elle va acheter des chèvres,pour les élever mais aussi elle renforce son épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 28 women are members of a banc villageois that was created on December 12, 2009. It is made up of members who live in the same village and surrounding area. They all get along well together and support each other. Their principal activities are commerce and raising livestock.

Ngore is 52 years old. She is standing at the right side of the photo and is waiving her hand. She is married and has eight children, three of whom are boys.

She raises cattle to earn income. She is going to use the loan to buy a steer for 150,000 XOF, as well as to buy some vaccines and cattle feed. She will use the cattle feed to fatten the steer. She hopes to resell the steer for 180,000 XOF.

With the profit she makes she is going to buy some goats to raise, but she is also going to keep some of the profit as savings at the banc villageois level.

loans.use: to buy a steer, vaccines and cattle feed.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta, age 44, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She and her husband have three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Vicenta requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Rysbubu

texts.ru: Рысбубу 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Рысбубу - среднее образование, с 2004 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Рысбубу на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова и 1 теленок. Доход от животноводства небольшой, поэтому Рысбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади, на которой муж Рысбубу сможет пасти скот односельчан, за это ему обещали большую зарплату. Доходы от кредита Рысбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
