Rysbubu is 43 years old, married and has three children. Rysbubu has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 2004. Thanks to persistent work, Rysbubu's farm currently has one cow and one calf. 

The income from the livestock breeding is small, and therefore Rysbubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS). She would like to purchase a horse, on which her husband can herd cattle for their fellow villagers. He has been promised a good salary for this. 

Rysbubu plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of cattle, and would like to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a printer to complement the services she already provides and carry out improvements to her premises.

loans.name: Savruzhon

texts.ru: Савружон уже много лет занимается бизнесом. Она трудолюбивый бизнес леди. Савружон занимается переработкой и продажей сухофруктов. Она имеет сад абрикоса, и каждый год она собирает урожай, перерабатывает, сушит и продает на местном рынке. Также она продает ядро абрикоса. Савружон также дополнительно покупает абрикосы для переработки, так как в саду всего лишь 20 штук абрикосов деревьев. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. С полученного дохода они женили своих 4 детей. Данное время она хочет купить дополнительно абрикосы для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Savruzhon has been involved in business for many years. She is a hardworking business lady. Savruzhon is involved in processing and selling dried fruits. She has an apricot garden, where she gathers a harvest every year, processes, dries and sells dried fruits at a local market. She also sells apricot seeds. In addition, Savruzhon buys apricots for processing because her garden only contains 20 apricot trees. Her husband helps her with running the business. They used the business profits to marry off their 4 children. At the present time, she wants to purchase additional apricots for increasing her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase additional apricots for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos con la ayuda de su padre aprendió del negocio de los cibercafé pues su padre lleva desempeñando esta actividad por un poco más de 7 años, como todo emprendedor y perseguidor de sueños decidió montar su negocio en base a lo aprendido y adquirido por su padre, su empresa ya lleva 2 años de operación y cree que es tiempo de expandirse y ofrecer servicios complementarios que vayan de la mano con los ya ofertados por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para adecuar cabinas telefónicas para realizar llamadas nacionales e internacionales buscando generar mayores recursos.
Su sueño es terminar su carrera universitaria y buscar otras oportunidades de negocio para ayudar a su familia
texts.en:
With the help of his father Carlos learnt the business of running a cyber cafe, since his father has been doing this for just over 7 years. Like any entrepreneur and dream chaser he decided to set up his business based on what he had learnt from his father. 

His business has been running for 2 years and he thinks it is time to expand and to offer complementary services which go hand in hand with those he offers already. For this reason he is asking for a loan to instal telephone booths for making national and international calls, with the intention of generating more income.

His dream is to finish his university degree and to look for other business opportunities to help his family.

loans.use: to instal telephone booths in his business for making national and international calls.

loans.name: Mariano Felipe

texts.es:
Mariano es un hombre de 34 años de edad casado y padre de dos hijos.
Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la costura, sus hijos estudian en la escuela primaria y se dedican a la práctica de deportes.
Mariano es sastre de profesión su especialidad son los trajes para danzas típicas folclóricas también realiza pantalones y trajes de vestir, su esposa es modista y confecciona vestidos de mujer también colabora con la costura y diseño de todo tipo de trajes. Juntos comparten un taller de costura, su trabajo es reconocido por su público que acude a ellos meses antes del carnaval donde se estrenan todos  los trajes anuales, los pedidos de trajes para esa fecha comienzan inmediatamente después de la fiesta del carnaval para la misma fiesta del año próximo. Su trabajo es riguroso y comparten la labor de vestir a cientos de bailarines que año tras año peregrinan a la ciudad de Oruro para demostrar su devoción a la virgen del socavón. Año tras año él sufre un problema en común, es la falta de capital económico para la compra de material de confección como; telas, lentejuelas, plumas sintéticas, etc.; “Todos los años sufrimos para conseguir dinero para la compra de nuestros materiales de trabajo, muchos veces no podemos financiarlo y perdemos trabajo”, comenta Mariano.
Mariano desea incrementar sus clientes para subir su producción y así mejorar sus ingresos para darle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Es por ese motivo que Mariano solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de confección de trajes típicos folclóricos.
texts.en:
Mariano is a 34 year-old married man who is the father of 2 children.

He shares his life with his wife, who is a dressmaker.  His children attend elementary school and are involved in sports.  Mariano is a tailor by profession; his specialty is making suits for the traditional folkloric dances.  He also makes pants and suits.  His wife is a stylist, and she makes women's dresses; she also works sewing and designing all types of suits.  Together they have a sewing workshop.  His work is well-known by the public, who come to him months before carnival, when they will wear the new costumes for the year.  People start making their orders for next year's festival right after the current year's carnival festival ends.

Mariano's work is rigorous, and he takes part in the work of clothing hundreds of dancers who year after year come to the city of Oruro to demonstrate their devotion to the Virgin of Socavon.  Year after year, he has suffered from the same problem: a lack of financial capital to buy the supplies such as fabrics, sequins, synthetic feathers, etc.  "Every year we struggle to get the money we need to buy our supplies, and many times we can't finance it and we lose work," comments Mariano.

Mariano wants to expand his customer base to raise his production and thereby increase his income in order to give his children a better future.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make traditional folkloric suits.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make suits for traditional folkloric dancers

loans.name: Norman Alberto

texts.es:
Norman es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive en Sayan junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 año es propietaria de una bodega y también trabaja como chofer. Le va muy bien porque es una  persona muy responsable, trabajadora, con muchos deseos de superación.
Norman está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio y ofrecer diversidad de productos, con esto sus ingresos mejorará y podrá cumplir su gran sueño: "Ampliar su negocio".
texts.en:
Norman is a young entrepreneur. He is 21 years old, single and lives in Sayan alongside his family. For more than one year, he has been owner of a small grocery store and also works as a driver. It is going very well because he is a very responsible, hard working person with desires to get ahead.

Norman is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they are providing, he will be able to buy merchandise to stock his business and offer a diversity of products. With this, his income will improve and he will be able to achieve his great dream: expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice-retailing.  Edna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy sacks of rice grains to sell through her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and she has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Ramonita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell.

Ramonita has been in this business for 11 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 33 años de edad soltera y madre de 2 hijos.
Su vida la reparte entre el trabajo y el cuidado de sus niños, el mayor de sus hijos ya asiste a la escuela primaria y el menor todavía es muy pequeño y se encuentra siempre al cuidado de su madre.
Elsa se dedica al comercio de llantas, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace 6 años, esta labor es un poco difícil por el volumen y peso de las llantas, aunque trabaja con un ayudante muchas veces se encuentra sola y le toca mover o trasladar las mismas. Sin embargo ella no se asusta por el trabajo duro y a pesar de ser madre es muy fuerte de bazos y de actitud. La vida cada vez le pone retos enfrente y ella sola sabe superarlos por al fuerte decisión de darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Ahora Elsa tiene la meta de mejorar su negocio, realizar la compra de llantas por mayor, es un paso grande para ella, otro desafío más en su vida pero sus hijos le dan la fuerza que ella pueda necesitar.
Es por ese motivo que Elsa solicita un préstamo para la compra de llantas por mayor para reinvertir y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa is 33 years old and is a single mother with 2 sons. She divides her life between working and looking after her children. The older of her sons already goes to primary school and the younger one is still very young and his mother looks after him all the time.

Elsa makes a living selling tyres and has been doing this for 6 years. The work is quite difficult because of the size and weight of the tyres. Although she works with an assistant she is often on her own and it is up to her to move the tyres. However she is not afraid of hard work and in spite of being a mother she has strong arms and a strong spirit. Life is always presenting her with challenges and she only knows how to deal with them because of her strong commitment to give her sons a better future.

Now Elsa's challenge is to improve her business by buying tyres wholesale. It's a big step for her, another challenge in life, but her sons give her the strength she needs. 

This is why Elsa is asking for a loan to buy tyres wholesale in order to reinvest in and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tyres wholesale in order to reinvest in and improve her business.

loans.name: Miguel Sergio

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre joven de 23 años de edad soltero y sin hijos.
Su vida la dedica al estudio y el trabajo, él termino sus estudios secundarios y para continuar estudiando tuvo que conseguir un trabajo como asalariado en una tienda de venta de artefactos electrónicos. Él mira la vida con mucho optimismo piensa que para triunfar sólo debe esforzarse un poco más, dentro de su trabajo es una persona puntual que le gusta cumplir sus funciones correctamente aunque para eso tenga que exceder sus horas de trabajo y quedarse a terminar sus labores, eso no le molesta porque de esa manera puede pagar sus estudios.
Miguel necesita 3 años para terminar sus estudios tiempo que se alargaría por la falta de material de ayuda como una computadora. Uno de sus principales problemas es la falta de tiempo, el trabajo le quita la mayoría de su tiempo y el resto lo dedica a sus estudios y la falta de una computadora muchas veces lo pone en dificultades. Miguel está acostumbrado a los retos y las ganas de triunfar no lo dejan darse por vencido.
Es por ese motivo que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora y con eso terminar sus estudio superiores.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 years old, single, and does not have children. He devotes his life to study and work. He finished high school, and then to continue studying he had to take a job in a store selling electronics.

He looks at life with a lot of optimism, and believes that to succeed all one has to do is work a little harder.

He is very punctual at work, and he likes to do his job correctly, even if that means staying after hours to finish his work. He is not bothered by this, because this is how he is paying for his studies.

Miguel needs three years to finish his studies. He will likely need more time to finish if he does not have the tools he needs, such as a computer. One of his biggest problems is a lack of time. Work takes up most of his time, and the rest he devotes to his studies, but he often ends up in difficulties because he does not have a computer.

Miguel is accustomed to challenges, but he also has a strong desire to succeed, so he doesn't give up. For this reason, he is requesting this loan to buy a computer to use to finish his university studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use to finish his university studies.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Irene is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy sacks of rice grains to sell through her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old and married.  

Catherine is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Catherine has been raising cattle for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Catherine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 48 years old and married, with one child.

Dominga works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Dominga has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Dominga aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 48 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nimfa has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Nimfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Raila

texts.ru: Райла, 59 лет, вдова,есть сын, который помогает матери материально, на данный момент, к примеру, за его денежный средства строят сарай.  У Райлы среднее образование, в качестве основного источника дохода, она на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Райлы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 12 коров, 1 лошадь и 1 жеребенок. Ежемесячный доход Райлы от бизнес деятельности составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Райла планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, что позволит ей улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Raila is 59 years old, a widow with one son, who helps her financially. For example, a barn is currently being built with his financial support. Raila has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years, having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Raila's hard work, today her business contains 12 cows, 1 horse and 1 foal.  Raila's monthly business income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Raila requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy cows. Raila plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business, which would allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: G.s. Misericordia De Dios Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Milagros de Dios esta conformado por tres integrantes los cuales son: Hazel Jacqueline, Santos Alberta y Ena Patricia todas mayores de edad con tres hijos los cuales todos aun están bajo su responsabilidad,todas ellas son muy luchadoras, emprendedoras lo que las motiva todos los días a realizar su trabajo con amor es el sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas de bien, originarias del municipio de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística,  Hazel quien es la coordinadora del grupo Solidario la cual se encarga de las responsabilidad y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales rellenos,revueltos, simples y elotes cocidos, negocio el cual lo inicia hace mas de 10 años, como un medio digno de sobrevivir, sus ventas son de forma ambulante, y sus compras las realiza al contado, empezó haciendo 20 tamales y 20 elotes cocidos hoy en día realiza 190 tamales y 150 elotes cocidos, ha tenido gran demanda de sus productos, inicia su jornada diaria desde un día antes comenzando a desgranar el maíz, para luego muy temprano del día siguiente, moler el maíz, y agragarle la cuajada, leche, sal, después preparar la masa para después hacer los tamales ya sea revueltos, simples o rellenos, y por ultimo ponerlo al fuego para luego sacarlos y tenerlos listos para que por las tardes salir a vender sus productos, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer a sus hijos y convertidos en todos unos profesionales al igual que realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y crecer mas en su negocio para obtener mejores utilidades, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima para la realización de este delicioso producto como : maíz, azúcar, sal, leña, hojas, queso, cuajada, leche, entre otros productos mas.
texts.en:
The Solidario Milagros de Dios group is made up of three members who are Hazel Jacqueline, Santos Alberta and Ena Patricia. They are all older with three children who are all still under their responsibility. All of them are hard working and enterprising. What motivates them everyday to do their jobs with love is the dream to see their children become good people. They are natives of the town of Chinandega, an area characterized by being commercially and touristically productive. 

Hazel, the coordinator of the group Solidario, is in charge and responsible for making payments on time. She is a small business woman who is dedicated to making and selling filled, scrambled and simple tamales and cooked corn. She started the business more than ten years ago as a dignified means to survive. Her sales are performed on foot and she makes her purchases on credit. She began making 20 tamales and 20 cooked corn. Today she makes 190 tamales and 150 cooked corn. She has had great demand for her products. She begins her daily routine the day before by starting to shell the corn. Then, very early on the following day, she grinds the corn and collects the curd, milk, salt. After, she prepares the dough to later make tamales that will be scrambled, simple or filled and finally makes the fire in which to put them and have them ready for the afternoon when she leaves to sell the products. One of her dreams is to be able to see her children grow and become professionals as well as perform improvements to her house and grow her business more to obtain better income. The objective of this loan is to buy raw material to make her delicious product such as maize, sugar, salt, firewood, leaves, cheese, curd, milk, among other products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like maize, sugar, salt, cheese, curd, milk, leaves, firewood, among others.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Esmeralda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Esmeralda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell for her business.

Esmeralda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Norhanena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norhanena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling gasoline and farming coconuts. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell for her general store business. 

Norhanena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Noriana

texts.en:
Noriana is 54 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Noriana has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and rice and buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is a 43-year-old married woman with six children, five currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Daisy has a dry goods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell, like blankets and curtains.

Ma. Daisy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods like blankets and curtains to sell

loans.name: Tazhinisa

texts.ru: Тажинисе 58 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Тажинисы - средне - специальное медицинское образование, она много лет проработала в больнице, на протяжении последних 10 лет занимается швейным делом, шьет одеяла, занавески, подушки в национальном стиле. Продукция ручной работы и пользуется большим спросом, принося ежемесячный доход от реализации около 10,000 сом (KGS). Однако, швейная машинка Тажинисы совсем старая и часто ломается, поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку новой швейной машинки.  Доходы от кредита Тажиниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своей деяытельности и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Tazhinisa is 58 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. Tazhinisa has a secondary-specialized, medical education and worked at a hospital for many years. She has been involved in sewing national-style blankets, drapes and pillows for the last 10 years. Her hand-made work is in high demand, the sales of which yield about 10,000 som (KGS) per month. However, Tazhinisa's sewing machine is very old and often breaks down, and this is why she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a new sewing machine. Tazhinisa plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Gulafshon

texts.ru: Гулафшон родилась в 1986 году. Она с детства всегда мечтала стать портнихой и шить красивые и модные платья. Гулафшон повзрослев, реализовала свою детскую мечту. Теперь она портниха  и предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она шьёт как национальные платья, так и европейские платья. Гулафшон этим бизнесом занимается уже более 6 лет.  Она с бизнесом справляется сама. Ее муж строитель, а дети еще маленькие. Гулафшон хочет купить новую швейную машинку, так как ее швейная машинка старая и шьет не качественно. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulafshon was born in 1986. Since childhood, she has always dreamed of becoming a seamstress and sew beautiful and stylish dresses. Gulafshon realized her childhood dream after growing up. Now she is a seamstress and provides her services at home. She sews national and European dresses. Gulafshon has been involved in this business for over 6 years. She manages the business by herself. Her husband is a construction worker, and children are still very young. Gulafshon wants to purchase a new sewing machine because her sewing machine is old and does not produce quality work. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en:
Merlito, is age 39, married, and blessed with two children. He has owned and operated a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport, for almost 13 years. He's earning a net income amounting to PHP 300 daily. His net income is usually spent on the school allowances of his children. 

Due to lack of capital on his business, he would like to avail himself of a loan, amounting to PHP 8,000, to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted, so that he can further improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items, such as sanitary pads, detergent soap, noodles, diapers, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc., to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, detergent soap, noodles, diapers, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc. 

Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as sanitary pads, detergent soap, noodles, diapers, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Irene has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft drinks, sanitary pads, canned goods, eggs, biscuits, shampoo, etc., to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Juliet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft drinks, sanitary pads, canned goods, eggs, biscuits, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Nalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nalina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending and raising livestock. Nalina is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is married and has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bags of cement for making hollow blocks.

Ofelia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of cement for making hollow blocks.

loans.name: Sahada

texts.en:
Sahada is 60 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Sahada has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling copra and farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 48 years old and married with one child who is in school.  Paz works very hard to provide for her family.

Paz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, and shampoo. Paz has been in this business for one year. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Paz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Jossie has engaged in a direct selling business within her community for almost a year now. She is 38 years of age and blessed with children. Her husband, Lito, helps her in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

Due to financial insufficiency, Jossie wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Jossie dreams of being rich through all her hard work. She hopes that she could always help in providing for their needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Tunu Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late thirties, is living alone with her own six children, three of whom are in school and the rest who are small. She has had a medium class food business known as a mamalishe where she serves soup, tea with chapati and other snacks, lunch food such as rice and ugali with meat, vegetables, beans etc. Rose has been in this business for two years and is able to make a good profit each month. She is in her business from 6 am to 6 pm daily.

She is requesting a third loan via Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to replenish her food store with cooking ingredients. Rose works hard and she used her profits to cover school fees and home food expenses. She believes that one day she will be able to grow her business and build a house. Rose will use her new request to expand her business by selling drinks. She is so thankful to everyone who will take the time to support her group.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Tunu” which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to expand her business by selling drinks.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Lolita is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish for her business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for  years now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Carmelita has been in this business for four years.

In the future Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,090 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Jean will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, refrigerator, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, water, and rice. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of  $100.00.  

Prisca is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, refrigerator, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, water, and rice

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 52-year-old married woman with six children, two currently in school.. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
Teresita has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,880 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She plans to recover through her ready-to-wear vending business. With your help, Analyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
A (USD) $ 800 loan is offered to Paulina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy food every day. With the loan, she will buy such items as tomatoes, oranges, capsicum, onions and  garlic. She has been in business since 2010. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Paulina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tomato, orange, gray, capsicum, onion and  garlic

loans.name: Vestline Group

texts.en:
John is in his 20s and manages a tailoring business. He is single and has been involved with this business for five years, making suits and trousers. John works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and makes a fair monthly profit. 

He is requesting his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credit to buy clothes-making materials. John paid his loan in full. He earned a profit which he used to pay rent and other expenses. He dreams of opening a successfully business to maximize his income. He will use this credit to buy materialsto make suits and other kind of clothes.

John will share this loan with his loan group, "’Vestlline" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy material to make suits and other kind of clothes.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: This is Rolando, 54 years old and married. He is busy managing his farming business. For almost 15 years in his business he has encountered so many problems with his farm like weather conditions. But he is a very strong and responsible person. He motivates himself always that whatever problems he encounters, God is always there for him. He borrowed money from ASKI and KIVA to sustain his farming business, so that he can give the quality of living to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 55 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Amelita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Amelita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Amelita has taken a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Amelita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: K.songlung Group

texts.en:
K.Songlung is the name of the group, and Phakhochong is the featured profile member, pictured with her hand raised. 

Phakhochong and her family reside in a hilly region of Manipur in the northeastern states of India. She is married and blessed with three children. The eldest daughter is in beginner class, whereas the younger ones haven’t started schooling. Her husband is a cultivator by profession, and his income is unreliable and undependable. Therefore, the family’s sustainable resource is very scant. 

Phakhochong wanted to engage herself in any income-generating business. However, since her kids are still young, they need extra care, and she could not neglect them. For the fulfillment of the required family expenditures, Phakhochong rears some chickens in her home yard. Her husband used to take the fully grown chickens to the market and sell them for more profit. Sometimes the villagers come and buy them from her house, too. 

She wanted to raise more chickens and expand the poultry. However, the light irregularity in the village is a hindrance to her small-income business. During the rainy season, the power supply is very poor in the village; hence, the chickens used to die due to insufficient heat supply inside the coop. 

Phakhochong wanted to avail a Kiva solar loan, with which she can buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system to light up the poultry at night and also to keep the chickens warm during the rainy season. Since it can light up 4 light bulbs for 12 hours a day and has a 90-meters-long wire, it can be installed in any four adjacent rooms as per the user’s convenience.

With the little profit she gets, Phakhoneng will use the money to manage her family’s expenses. She also wanted to save a little amount from the income for her children for their future use. 

Likewise, the rest of the members, too, want to avail a solar loan for their own respective income-generating business activities, such as a grocery store, vegetable vending, and also for their children so that they will be able to study in the evening by the light of these solar systems.

loans.use: to buy a mini solar home lighting system to light up her poultry at night.

loans.name: T.khonom Group

texts.en:
Lhingkhohoi lives in New Keithelmanbi in Manipur, India, with her husband, two daughters and a son. She is the featured profile member of T.Khonom, and is pictured with a raised hand. Her husband works at a stone quarry near the village riverbank. Seasonally, he makes charcoal and sells it in the market, too. 

To manage the household expenses and children’s school expenditures with just the meager income of her husband is a great concern for Lhingkhohoi and her husband. The living expenses and the children’s educational expenses, such as the school van monthly fare and tuition fees, are increasing, whereas the income of the family is still stagnant. 

Therefore, in order to supplement the household income, Lhingkhohoi and her group members took an initiative to uplift their economic and financial status by accessing loans. 

Lhingkhohoi opened a pan shop near her house. Since the shop is near a national highway, it attracts lots of customers. She used to earn 1,000 INR per day, but due to irregular power supply in the village, she could not continue her business smoothly after sunset. Therefore, she wanted to avail a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system loan as a backup to light up her pan shop to run the business until late hours. Lhingkhohoi shares that working without proper lighting makes her slow down her work, and attending customers in improper lighting is very inconvenient. She believes that by installing this solar light, her business will improve, and at the same time, make her tasks easier to complete. 

The rest of the team members also need mini solar lights for their respective income-generating activities. The other members are into vegetable cultivation, pan shop and weaving activities.

loans.use: to buy a 45-watt solar light to install in her pan shop so she can stay open for longer hours at night.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 41 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc..

Elma has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from selling plastic ware and raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand to cement the floor of her home

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Primitiva requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Primitiva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Juan Adrían

texts.es:
Juan tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está soltero, es padre de un hijo pero  la esposa decidió dejarlo, él vive en casa de su madre, y por lo tanto su madre y su pequeña hija son las únicas que dependen de Juan.

Juan se dedica a la venta de frutas y a la ganadería. La venta de frutas lo realiza desde hace 10 años, él vende las frutas en una parada de buses y le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos de su casa, el trabajo de la ganadería lo hace desde hace tres años, esto se lo enseño un tío ya que ambos realizan compra y venta de ganado en los tianguis.


Juan necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca que le venden a buen precio, esto le ayudará mucho porque ya serán 4 vacas las que ordeñará y así aumenta la producción leche.

Sus sueños son que Dios le dé vida para poder seguir trabajando en la ganadería, pues le deja muchas ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 26 years old and studied thorough his third year of high school. He is single and the father of one child. His wife decided to leave him, so he now lives at his mother’s house. Juan’s mother and young daughter are the only ones who are dependent on him.

Juan sells fruit and livestock. He has been selling fruit for 10 years. Juan sells the fruit at a bus stop that is located 10 minutes from his house. He has been working with livestock for the past three years. Juan learned this trade from an uncle and now both of them buy and sell livestock at the open air markets.

Juan needs a loan so that he can buy a cow that he can sell at a good price. This will be of great help because he will have four cows for milking, which will increase his dairy production. His dream is that God will grant him life so that he can continue working with livestock, which will allow him to earn more income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow that he can sell at a good price.

loans.name: Yojanan

texts.es:
Yojanan tiene 19 años, nació en  la provincia Ñuflo de Chávez, del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia, actualmente vive con su madre y sus tres hermanos menores; trabaja en una empresa inmobiliaria en el área de ventas.   

La vida de Yojanan no ha sido fácil, pues él vino al mundo cuando su madre tenía 16 años, luego empeoro con la separación de sus padres; pero al enfrentar estos problemas junto a su familia le ha enseñado ser una persona responsable, el cual lucha por sus sueños y se supera. 

A Yojanan le apasiona su carrera de Administración de Empresas, pues considera que tiene las aptitudes y las cualidades necesarias para ser un buen administrador en cualquier ámbito, tanto en lo personal como en lo laboral; sin embargo, sus ingresos no son suficientes para pagar su carrera universitaria, él considera que la mejor inversión que se puede hacer en la vida es la educación de nuestra mente a través del estudio. Es por eso que solicita un crédito educativo para poder culminar su carrera ya que aún le falta cursar dos años y medio. 

Su sueño es tener su propia empresa y hacerla exitosa aplicando las herramientas que está aprendiendo en la Universidad.

Yojanan se siente muy agradecido con Dios y con aquellas personas que con un buen corazón deciden ayudar a otros dándoles la oportunidad de superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Yojanan is 19 and was born in Ñuflo de Chávez Province in the Santa Cruz Department of Bolivia. He lives with his mother and three younger siblings and as a salesman in a furniture business.  

Yojanan's life hasn't been easy; he was born when his mother was only 16, and his parents later split up, making the family's situation worse. Facing these problems with his mother and siblings taught Yojanan responsibility, and he strives to fulfill his dreams and make his life better. 

Yojanan's Business Administration courses have inspired him, and he feels that he has the abilities and qualities to be a strong manager in any setting, personal or professional. Yojanan's income, however, isn't enough to pay tuition at his university. He thinks the best investment that anyone can make is in education, expanding the mind through study. He is therefore applying for a student loan so that he can finish the last two and a half years of his program. 

Yojanan's ambition is to run his own business and achieve success using the knowledge and experience his gaining at the university. 
 
Yojanan is very grateful to God and the people who, out of the goodness of their hearts, decide to help others by providing them the opportunity to make their lives better.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his Business Administration program.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es: María tiene 66 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales desde hace treinta años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo va saliendo adelante. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y repellar las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Maria is 66 years old and has earned a living for thirty years selling natural juice drinks.  She is a hard-working woman who with a great deal of effort is getting ahead in life.  To improve her living conditions, she has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor and re-plaster the walls of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor and to re-plaster the walls of her home

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Divina has engaged in a variety store business within her community for almost fifteen years now. She is 36 years of age and blessed with four children. Her husband, Roderick, works as a product dealer, and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their family’s needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Divina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Divina wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of 14,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Divina hopes to add more stock of grocery items she presently doesn't have in her storehouse. She dreams that she could help her children to finish their studies through her humble business. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a ice drop vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal. Alma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her ice drop vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa de 53 años de edad vive sola, sus hijos ya son independientes pero le ayudan económicamente, ella tiene 10 años de elaborar y vender pupusas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijol, queso, chicharrón, etc.  para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elsa, 53 years old, lives alone.  Her children now support themselves and help her financially.  She has been working for ten years at making and selling pupusas.  Her business is located in the home, and helps her to pay some of the costs of maintaining her home.  She is asking for a loan to buy corn, beans,cheese, pork rinds, etc., in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, etc. for making pupusas to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 51 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming rice for nine years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Arriza

texts.en:
Arriza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years now.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mehtap

texts.en:
Mehtap has two children in school.  She sells jewelry, baby vests, and linens.  She says she has to work to earn extra income.  She is a very talented and determined woman.  With the loan, she’ll buy jewelry, beads, and baby clothes to sell.  


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Mehtap Hanım’ın 2 çocuğu var ve okula gidiyorlar.  Mehtap Hanım,takı,bebek yelekleri,çamaşır satışı yapıyor.  Ek gelir elde etmek için çalışmak zorunda olduğunu söylüyor.  Çok yetenekli ve azimli bir kadın.  Aldığı krediyle,takı boncuğu ve bebek eşyaları alıp satacak.

loans.use: buy jewelry, beads, and baby clothes

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 37 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. Lourdes and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,570 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  Lourdes has been with NWTF borrower since 2012 and she plans to recover through her vegetable vending. With your help, Lourdes can rebuild her house, and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia de 36 años de edad es una persona emprendedora, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia, ella trabaja como secretaria en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar lamina, hierro, balcones, y pago de mano de obra, para poder colocar las puertas y ventanas y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir seguros.
texts.en: Silvia, who is 36 years old, is an enterprising person.  She has two children and lives in her own house.  Silvia works as secretary for a private enterprise.  What she earns at work covers some of the costs for her home.  She wants to improve the home, but with what she earns doesn't have enough money. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy metal sheeting, iron, window grates and to pay for labor to mount a door and windows, so that her family can live with greater security.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, iron, window grates and pay for labor

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with eleven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal, rice and pineapple.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 64 years old and married with six children. 

Genara is in the agriculture business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Genara has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Genara would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 52 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lucia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lucia has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 8,471 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Lucia is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Baby Liza

texts.en:
Baby Liza is 28 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Baby Liza has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a secondhand clothing business that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as shirts, pants, trousers, shorts, long sleeve shirts, short sleeve shirts, and clothing for children.

She opened her secondhand clothing business a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Romana is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, trousers, shorts, long sleeve shirts, short sleeve shirts, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en: Ma. Teresa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her food vending business, and is now requesting a PHP 9,871 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Ma. Teresa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 58 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan in the amount of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar. Notably, Grace has borrowed and successfully repaid 9 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional items (e.g., canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar) to sell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina is 52 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. Dina has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years, and also earns an income from clothing sales and frozen foods. Dina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ricaurte De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Ricaurte  se desempeñó como trabajador ejerciendo el cargo de auxiliar de ventas, y por avanzada edad se tuvo que retirar no conforme con quedarse en su hogar sin mover un solo dedo decidió iniciar un negocio de venta de calzado en la zona comercial de su ciudad desempeñándose como vendedor y gracias a esta actividad puede sentirse útil y servible para sus semejantes. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de calzado pues sabe que en este negocio hay que estar rotando y trayendo nuevas colecciones y diseños para vender, pues quiere salir adelante, progresar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricaurte served as an assistant sales worker, but had to retire due to his advanced age. 

He wasn't happy staying in his house without moving a single finger, so he decided to start a business selling shoes in the commercial area of his city, working as a salesman. Thanks to this work, he can feel useful and serviceable to his fellow people.

He's seeking a loan to buy shoes. He knows that in this business, one has to rotate and try new collections and designs to sell. He wants to get ahead, progress and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk to get a greater profit from their sale.

loans.name: Estakio

texts.en:
Estakio is a 46-year-old, married man with four children. His children are between the ages of 5 and 21 years old. He and his family reside in Hoima, Uganda.

He is a salary earner and farms as a supplementary source of income. His goal is to complete his house.

He is seeking this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 33 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Haide has been farming bananas for 4 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Haide is seeking this loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more varieties of bananas and fertilizers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming business by purchasing new varieties of banana and fertilizers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 29-year-old married woman who supports a family of two children. Her husband earns additional income to support their family.

Veronica has been operating a carpentry business for 14 years, which enables her to earn approximately 20,000 KES per month.

Veronica is now seeking her third loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES, from VisionFund Kenya. With the loan proceeds, she intends to add more stocks of timber, plywood, and block boards for her workshop to meet the expectations of her clients. She plans to use the expected increase in her income as a result of the loan to educate her children and to pay for their education at higher levels. In the future, she hopes to start a dairy business and to become a successful businesswoman in her community.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional stocks of plywood, timber, and block boards

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 46 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming corn and peanuts in the Philippines. Imelda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming corn and peanuts for seven years, and also earns additional income from food vending and motorcycle transport. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, canned goods, spices, meat, etc, for her restaurant business. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from buying and selling coconut meat.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, canned goods, spices, meat, etc

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Steven, who is in his late 30’s, is single with one child who is still at school. He has been running a business of selling chips for six months now.  He works from 4 P.M. until after midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Steven's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to sell charcoal, had a motorcycle business and started selling chips.  He has paid back all of his loans successfully.  He is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support of their group.  He used the profits to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal for cooking, and to renovate the selling place by putting in tiles, a washing sink and umbrellas.  He dreams of buying a plot of land. Steven will share this loan with his loan group "SARANGA" with the two members holding each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal for cooking, and to renovate his selling place.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: Silvia tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 19 años y 8 años de edad. Silvia se dedica  a la venta de pollo desde hace 20 años y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso y repellar las paredes de la vivienda. De esta forma espera mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 43 years old and lives in her own house together with her two daughters, 19 and 8 years of age. Silvia has made a living selling chicken for 20 years and this is how she manages to provide for her household. 

With the hope of improving her living conditions she has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, and gravel to set the floor in cement and plaster the walls of her home. In this way she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand and gravel for setting the floor in cement and plastering the walls of her home.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is a single father charged with taking care of two children.

To earn a living, he sells salon accessories and also owns a salon in Hoima, Uganda. He started his business to improve his family’s standard of living. He explains that competition and limited capital hinder his business.

He is seeking this loan to buy more cosmetics and braids to sell to his customers. He future goal is to expand his business into new markets.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing additional cosmetics and braids for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Jeniefer

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jeniefer works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal. Jeniefer is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, rice noodles, eggs, spices, etc. for her restaurant business. Jeniefer has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, rice noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Marife is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,521 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been with NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her food vending business. With your help, Marife can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business, and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Idalia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Idalia tiene 44 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Idalia trabaja como auxiliar de cocina desde hace 20 años y es así como junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión de la energía eléctrica y para comprar cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Idalia is 44 years old and lives in her own house together with her partner. Idalia has worked as a kitchen assistant for 20 years and this is how, together with her husband, they maintain the household finances.

With the hope of improving her living conditions, she has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the connection of electricity and to purchase cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her home.

loans.name: Yenifer Noemy

texts.es: Yenifer tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 9 años y su hijo de 5 meses de edad. Yenifer es una mujer luchadora quien junto a su esposo van sacando adelante a su familia. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión de la energía eléctrica y para comprar cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de la vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yenifer is 26 years old and lives in the house she owns together with her life partner, her 9 year old son and her 5 month old son.  Yenifer is a strong woman who is moving her family forward together with her husband.  

She has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in an electricity connection and to purchase cement and sand to plaster the walls of her home.  She hopes that she can count on this loan and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in an electricity connection and to purchase cement and sand to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Ivania Susanie

texts.es: Ivania Susanie: Es una persona sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada. Tiene 39 años de edad. Con el propósito de disponer de un sistema de saneamiento, solicita financiamiento para la construcción fosa y tanque séptico, ya que actualmente usa letrina y durante el invierno presenta dificultades para poder acceder, debido a que el suelo es arcilloso. Con los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le han permitido mejorar su vivienda: Hacer las divisiones de los cuartos e instalar el pantry. Su sueño es terminar de construir su baño, tener un sistema sanitario e instalar un tanque de agua segura para tener acceso al servicio de agua permanente.
texts.en:
Ivania Susanie is a sociable person.  She is originally from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 39 years old and married.  

In order to install a sanitation system, she is requesting a loan to build a ditch and a septic tank, since she currently has a latrine and it is difficult to access in the winter, since the soil is clayey.  She has been able to improve her home with previous loans from Pana Pana, including dividing rooms and installing a pantry.  

Her dream is to finish building her bathroom, have a sanitary system, and install a secure water tank so she has permanent access to running water.

loans.use: to build a ditch and a septic tank.

loans.name: Ismael Benito

texts.es:
El señor Ismael Benito, labora como zapatero en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León,  desde hace quince años  inicia su labores  a las 07:00 am finalizando a las 04:00 pm en  este mismo horario de lunes a domingo, realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

El señor Ismael,  solicito a  Ceprodel  un crédito el que utilizo para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda como es la compra de hierro para la construcción de un portón, o cual le permitirá mejorar la seguridad a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Ismael Benito works as a shoemaker at one of the markets in the city of Leon.  He has done this work for 15 years.  He starts work at 7:00am and finishes at 4:00pm from Monday to Sunday.  He does this work to support his household.

Ismael is requesting a loan from Ceprodel in order to improve the infrastructure of his home by purchasing iron to build a gate.  This will allow him to improve the security of his humble home.

loans.use: to purchase iron to build a gate.

loans.name: Maye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 octobre 2013. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. Une bonne entente les anime.Leur activité principale c'est le commerce.
Maguette, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 30ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont un garçon.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissu, de drap, de robes; une activité qu'elle mène depuis son intégration dans le banc villageois.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter du tissu pour une valeur de 30000f. Elle va coudre 10 robes à 6000f par unité. Elle compte vendre une robe à 15000f.
les bénéfices lui servent à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
